Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary659497
Reviews.Content: Our room smelled like vomit. The carpet was wet right outside the bathroom. We did not have heat in our room. First night after calling the front desk to complain maintenance brought up a space heater. The space heater kept blowing the power in our room. We had no power in our room the second night for over 20 minutes. We spend the 2nd night freezing. After placing three calls to the front desk to get someone to come to our room to see the issue we were told to use another outlet to heat the room. The power blew two more times. Finally after much discussion with the manager and maintenance engineer they decided to turn the heat on in the hotel. Many excuses were given to our problem. We were only offered a $50 credit off of our room for a 3 night stay. This was completely unacceptable to me. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Nor will I ever be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, no lunch, no bathtubs”
Reviews.Author: Comitis
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this property on business for 5 nights and our meeting is being held here. Location is good for walking to the Boston Commons and restaurants. My room is a cubicle - and in speaking to my colleagues, their rooms are also tiny. So much so that it is a tight squeeze between the end of the bed and the wall to get to the desk and freestanding closet. There are no bathtubs in the bathrooms and there are no vanities at the sinks. The bathrooms have glass shelves above the toilets but they are shallow. The hotel has larger rooms with tubs and vanities but front desk clerk said they are few and provided to people with special needs - whatever that means. One of my colleagues is claustrophobic so she was allowed one of these rooms. The hotel bar is really cozy and has live entertainment but serves no food. The restaurant is open for breakfast and dinner only so during inclement weather you have to walk about 3 blocks to cafes or fast food - not a big deal unless it's freezing outside! I guess the main reason I don't like this property is the tiny room with terrible bath amenities. It's hard to be on the road a lot and I travel more than 50% of the time. The room is home away from home and this one was like a Japanese efficiency hostel. I was very disappointed. I am Gold with Marriott and expected better. My friend who is Platinum had the same type room - so they don't feel the need to reward frequent travellers at this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time”
Reviews.Author: kcrwley
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline for 100, which was a good deal. Great location. Yes rooms are small, but clean. I called to make sure we had a king size bed, which we did. They were very accommodating at check in as we asked to be on a higher floor with a view if possible. They gave us 9th for over looking back bay. Now I had been told that the area turns into night club central on the weekends (you wouldn't know this during the day) But starting around 10pm the whole area was filled with people lining up for the clubs (great people watching material) We sat in the lounge bar and listened to the jazz band they had playing, which was good, until we got the bill, $10.00 for a mixed drink, ok not that bad, but $6.00 for a soda???? That was a little crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Ana P
Reviews.Content: I decided to invite my sister from New York to come visit. So I went on Priceline and got a good deal for February 24-26, 2 nights-3 days. I called before to confirm and I was told I was going to get a King sized bed and a sofa bed ( which is great since it was going to be 3 of us in the room). When we checked in and went to the room that wasn't the case. We did get a king sized bed but no sofa. I didn't stress it much cuz all of could fit in the bed. We decided to read about the hotel and realized they had rollaway bed. So I called down for one. The room wasn't so big but there was enough space for the rollaway to fit. If they had less desk space the bed would've even better. They have a coffee maker but the coffee is gross and watered down. Bathroom is average sized? The only downside of it all is you hear the clobbers coming out from partying if you are in a lower floor. We were in the 7th and we could hear them screaming. But overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jmb21980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard on Tremont St in Boston on Feb 10, 2012. My boyfriend and I booked tickets to see a comedy show at the Wibur Theater & decided to turn it into a short getaway by staying in a near by hotel. The hotel was extremely close to the theater (we walked to & from the show). We had a blast. The room was small (the king sized bed took up the majority of the room) but if your only staying in the hotel to sleep, it was perfect. The room was comfortable & clean. The service was fabulous & we booked the valet parking included package, so we had no worries or surprise costs. The bathroom was extremely small & the hotel breakfast buffet was ok, but it was worth the value. I would defiately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: daisymae531
Reviews.Content: Good for 1 night stay, close to Boston commons, State House, Legal Seafood, downtown etc. Great Staff, if you need to use a computer bring your own bc they only have 3 which are always occupied. Only received one sheet and a very thin blanket, maid must of forgot to put on comforter. Excellent staff. Must eat at Legal seafood for best Lobster you will EVER have in your life.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: hiflya
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the not so good reviews of this hotel. As a Marriott Gold member, I was given one of smallest rooms I've seen in years - and that includes a lot of travel overseas. OK - its a very old building and they can only make them so big. On the bright side, there is wireless Internet and it was within walking distance of my client dinner for the evening which is why I decided to stay there. When making reservations, make sure you get the prepaid parking rate, it will save $20 on the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: julia6781
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the theater district - orange line T-stop Tufts Medical Center is right across the street not even 2 minutes from the entrance. All the cultural venues are around the corner, and Chinatown/Downtown is about 5-10 minutes walk. After reading a reviews, I have asked the lady at the check-in, if it would be possible to get a quite room due to the fact that I would be staying there for 3 weeks and study a lot for the January term. She was very friendly, changed by room to the 11th floor, and also have taken the time to show me the map of where the room lies to make sure that it would be ok (so I guess it all a matter of asking politely). The room has a nice size - its not the newest one and in some corners really outdated, but clean and for my purpose just fine. The bed was good, the desk had enough room to study and work, and the free wi-fi connection was a plus. However, it is not secured, so sending very important and private information might not be a good idea unless you have to do so ;-) There is a small fridge in the room, where you can store some drinks and small foods. Coffee maker with normal and decaf coffee pads, and a vending and ice machine on each floor.... Only one negative - the air-conditioning/heat in the room is really old. When you turn it on and stay close to it (work desk right next to it), it will practically "dry" your skin ..... But I guess as European I am just not used to this old-fashioned types of heating systems :-D P.S. All the staff I have approached in the 3 weeks I stayed there were VERY friendly and helpful - maybe the response you will get really depends on the way you talk to them :-)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Lindasmithhh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Courtyard Downtown Boston for two nights while attending a concert at the Wilbur theater across the street and doing some sightseeing. Having read the reviews of the hotel I was aprehensive about staying there but we used rewards points and figured it was just one night. The first thing that I noticed in the hotel is that the lobby is absolutely stunning. Lauren at the front desk was absolutely great and explained that the building was opened as an elks lodge in the twenties and had a long somewhat sorted history. I explained my concerns about the noise and roomsize and as a gold member she said she was able to put me in a room on the 12 floor towards the back of the building away from the noise. We did not hear anything aside from some loud older gentlemen coming back from the same concert but that is par for the course in downtown hotels. Also the cuecumber water in the lobby is a very nice touch. Coffee being available all day would be a nice touch. The room was small as I had read on here and was somewhat prepared for. It was more than adequet for the two of us for the evening. The rooms could use an update and a slightly larger bathroom. Would not want to stay in the room for a month but as a place to sleep it does its job. I guess that is the trade off for the hotels very good location. There are several theaters and nightclubs in the area so it felt like there was always something going on. There were lines of young people waiting to get into the night clubs and the valet told me it was "just a typical saturday". The concierge Ryan also did a very nice job. My husband forgot to print our tickets to the show and he was able to bring us to the front desk and print them for us. He also provided us with a list of restaurants close to the hotel but pointed us towards a small hole in the wall restaurant called the daily catch in the north end (see my review of them too), when we walked in we were a bit shocked that someone from a hotel would send us there as many other restaurants in the neighborhood look much nicer, but after trying their shrimp scampi i completely understood. After dinner we went to another recommended place for dessert called Mikes Pastry which again did not disappoint. Overall we had a much better experience at the hotel than we thought we were going to. It is true in a business like hotels the people really make or break you and the staff at the Boston Downtown Courtyard makes them from the bellman on the way in to the female security guard (whos name I can not remember) who helped us store our bags I do not think that we saw a single employee ther without a welcoming smile. I would recommend this hotel more to the people traveling for pleasure than for business as the rooms are not very condusive to getting alot of work done just based on their size.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst...”
Reviews.Author: Cmb1946
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what was the most horrible aspect of my New Years Eve stay at the Marriott Tremont: the dirty tiny room, the amazing amount of noise all night from the bar/club below, or the $40 a day hotel parking fee. However, if I was going to pick a winner I think it would have to be the paper thin walls (and I do mean paper thin) which allowed my wife and I to listen to the lady next door having sex at 3am, retching/vomiting at 5 am (not kidding), and then have a drag out fight with the front desk on the phone at 8am. All in all, a wonderful hotel and a great stay! Would recommend highly!

Reviews.Title: “great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mag2712
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for it's location because it's right by Tufts Medical Center. The people at the concierge desk were super friendly and very helpful. They gave me a free map and a list of restaurants in the area, which was great, and also told me a short cut to get to Tufts. The room itself was much smaller than I expected. I didn't have any problems with wireless in my room or the thermostat. The walls were a little thin because I could sometimes hear the couple in the room next to me but this never turned out to be a problem. However, I did have some minor issues with noise based on the hotel's location later in the night. I went to bed around midnight on a Sunday night and some time after that, it sounded like a theater show had let out because a crowd of voices coming from outside woke me up. Then, I was woken up again later in the night when a bunch of people were walking down the street in front of the hotel and one girl was literally yelling down the street. I am a pretty light sleeper though. I didn't have any problems with noise on the next night. Also, sink faucets in my room were leaky, you had to crank them all the way around to get a sizable stream of water out and at certain points would let out an annoying high-pitched squeaky sound. There also wasn't a mini-fridge or complimentary bottled water. Despite all these problems, I still had a pretty good stay, mainly because it was unbelievably convenient for me to get from the hotel to restaurants for food and all the other places I needed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Happily surprised”
Reviews.Author: A1972j
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at this hotel when we were in town to see a play at the Wang. The location was convenient. Our room was a end room on the 10th floor. The room was clean, quiet, and bigger than I had anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; small, dated rooms with no wireless”
Reviews.Author: SMB4_1958
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on its location: a couple of blocks from Boston Common where I was attending Boston First Night activities. It is also nicely located in the Theater District, across from the Wang Center. The rooms in this hotel are small (to the extreme), and dated. The beds are comfortable, the television cannot be rotated left to right for viewing, and the room had a shower but no bath. The water was luke warm when I took my shower. The walls seemed to be very thin and both my wife and I were awakened by a baby crying next door in the middle of the night. There was no wireless in the room, only in the hotel lobby. Based on room price I might stay here again. I got a good rate on the Internet which may have been helped by reserving early. This rate was partially negated by a $40 valet charge for parking. However, if I were to be staying more than one night, I would probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sweeti4027
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and service was great but the rooms were small.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms. Faded hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeFMarkhamON
Reviews.Content: The room was so small small that you literally could not turn around. Barely room for the bed and the television. Bathrooms even smaller. It seems like one old room was divided into 3 new rooms. Towels were Kleenex thin and bedding lumpy and uncomfortable. Air conditioning loud but effective. Halls looked like they had seen better days, many better days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Clyntonium
Reviews.Content: Easily the best part of this hotel is its location right in the theater district. It's just a couple blocks from Boston Common and there are two T stops nearby, as well as Chinatown. Great place to be. The rooms are very small, even by Boston standards. I stayed in a king room that had a desk and a chair and scarcely much room for anything else inside. Bathroom was a shower only. Nothing special, but adequate. Price was great too. Service was nothing special. The woman who checked us in wasn't friendly, but she wasn't rude either.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: EastTennMan
Reviews.Content: The location is not too bad, particularly if you are wanting to stay in the theater district. I was there for a conference and the location is not as appealing as one near Seaport or the convention center. Nice restaurants within 2-4 blocks such as Legal Seafood, Maggiano's, Davio's, and Smith & Wollensky. There's a little market next door to the hotel where you can get snacks, cokes, etc. The room was small but nice. I didn't have any problems with outside noise as some posters had advised. The doorman "William" was great and very helpful. I thought all of the staff was friendly and courteous. I'd probably not stay here again unless there was another meeting at this hotel. I say that only because I'd prefer to stay closer to Copley Square or the Seaport Blvd. area near the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MdTravelerX2
Reviews.Content: I've come to expect more from Marriott. Our room and bathroom were quite small. The PBS stream for the entire hotel was out for all four nights we were there. The GM was in the lobby and asked about my stay on the 3rd day. I mentioned that PBS was out and he was unaware. So was the Front Desk when we asked them about it on two occasions. Our first night, the fire alarm went off a 12:30. False alarm, thank goodness. Our room was typically not serviced until mid to late afternoon. Worst was on our last morning, we discovered black mold behind the curtains. It explained a lot of our breathing stuffiness. The manager on duty came up to inspect. They are taking this room out of service. They did offer me Marriott Rewards points for the trouble. All that said, I'd probably stay here again. It's very convenient to many activities, theaters, restaurants, historic sites, the T, etc. Our room didn't have a view but it was quite quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: DedhamPrincess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a different hotel this year for our annual weekend in Boston. We gave the Courtyard a try. We were NOT IMPRESSED!! We pulled up in front of the hotel and the valet attendant was nowhere to be found. We had to get out and wait at the front desk. Once found our car sat in front of the hotel for over 1/2 hour. My husband asked that it be parked and got a snippy answer. The fire alarm went off not ONCE but TWICE at 12:30AM. A form letter was tossed under the door explaining the situation. Not even a free breakfast was offered. When I made a comment to the front desk the next morning she gave me a strange look and handed me my bill and sent me on my way. If you are looking for great service, attentive valet attendants and an overall great hotel go a few doors down to the W.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with average service”
Reviews.Author: INTLTRVLDUDE
Reviews.Content: The location is located in the theater district of Boston. Subway station is 5-minute walk away. Chinatown is 7-minute walk away. Services at front desk is average at best. Be aware that if you stay at the lower levels, you will hear the noise and bass coming from the clubs downstairs and nearby. It is kind of annoying. Also, the wall is so thin that you can hear people talking next room clearly. The only good thing of this hotel is its location only.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep, not hang out”
Reviews.Author: Mitch V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and certainly meets the Marriott standard. Good rates (relative to Boston) can be obtained here as well. However, as expected, the hotel is old, and the rooms are cramped. Ultimately, a good vacation spot for a place to put your head and get out and see the city during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room”
Reviews.Author: biribilis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located one block away from Boston Commons, the rooms where very big and clean and the hotel staff was as helpfull as it could. The area around the hotel is really good and you can go about exploring the city easily from it's location. There is a trolley bus office near the hotel if you want to catch it to go sightseeing around the city, The hotel is close to theaters that you can catch a show if you want and some great reastaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Boston Downtown Tremont”
Reviews.Author: IRISHGAL30
Reviews.Content: Really nice central location. Perfect for getting everywhere around central Boston. Rooms Standard and clean and comfy (apart from the noise). Most of the staff professional and really nice and helpful and friendly. Clean and tidy and basic rooms. Problem was it is extremely noisy with the air generators out the back . Where we stayed ,there was these air conditioner generator machines out the back and they were on all the time all night long, they were extremely noisy and loud and kept us awake most of the time. Also on our floor we were next door to a "market" little shop which had this machine which was sounded like an air conditioner generator machine ( in with the food machines separate -dont know what it was) and it was so loud - our sleep was badly affected while we were there. The staff were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, rooms ok!”
Reviews.Author: CarolynAlisa
Reviews.Content: Decent location - very friendly staff! The rooms were as you'd expect for a Marriott - nothing fancy but clean and tidy! Good size desk and wi-fi access for a work trip! Not a very good view from the room - backed onto another building.

Reviews.Title: “Convienient location and a good home base-- but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: akhdaniel
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed 2 nights here for a weekend in Boston and to see a show at the Wang Theater. Luckily, we were on a government rate because I would have been disappointed at the size of the room if I had paid full price. Other than that, it was an excellent place to stay to see Boston-- centrally located and we could walk to everything we wanted to do. The front desk staff was exceptionally helpful in reccomending places to eat, calling a cab, and giving advice on when to depart for the airport, etc. I would stay here again because of that, but not if I had to pay $250 to $300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: LauderdaleByTheSea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the theater district across from The Wang theater. The Boston Common is a short walk and the Boylston Station T. The front office will give you a list of attractions and directions. The front desk was very helpful, we were given an early check in, a late check out and switched rooms. The hotel has very small rooms, however it is reasonably priced. We were able to get a larger room upon request. Do ask for a corner room on a high floor. The hotel is old but the location and price are a good trade off.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jimmycomms
Reviews.Content: I assume this isn't the benchmark for a Courtyard Marriott because if it is it wouldn't explain the success of this hotel chain. This is an average hotel in a great location. The rooms are small - which I guess is what they mean by "European style" and the decor is modest. The beds are however very comfortable which I'm sure you'll agree is reasonably important in a hotel. I missed the lack of a fridge in the room until I found the ice bucket and ice vending machine a few feet away from my room (or to be perfectly honest, my wife did). Satisfied, but not overly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolfgirl61
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of October 2011 for a business event. The rooms and bathrooms are very small and stuffy. My room had peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, dark moldy corners, etc Definitely in need of some renovations. The lobby was very nice and the breakfast buffet was good. The meeting rooms were also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Dagje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in October 2011. We drove into Boston on a Friday night and traffic was hell. The hotel is in the middle of the theater district so during weekends be prepared for some traffic. As for the hotel, this is an average hotel. Clean but the rooms are not very big. Negative point was that every morning of our stay we were woken up by noise. First morning by the alarm clock from the next room (!). Next mornings by the people next door who were just talking! For this kind of hotel and this price we would have expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Not my best Marriott experience”
Reviews.Author: MrsJngs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a conference. I often stay in Marriott hotels when I travel. I wish I would have stayed at another Marriott. Location is good, Not as close as other Marriott properties to the Hynes Convention Center.Rooms very small-I felt like I was in my old college dorm room. No bathtub. Noisy-I was on the 11th floor. I have not been in a hotel where I could so clearly hear people in the rooms down the hall. About the temperature- very cold at night and then BAM..the system is turned off by the hotel in the am. By 10am I could hardly breath. I know it had to be close to 80+ degrees in the room. I called the front desk and was told that the hotel turns off the air/heat from am till 5pm. I paid how much to suffocate? I was offered a fan if one was availble...I could not stay any longer and had to leave to get air. I would recommend staying here if you are a person who likes to sleep or sleep in late. I stayed at the Hotel Commonwealth 2 years ago while vacationing and needless to say I was wishing I had stayed there on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless Boston nights”
Reviews.Author: Saag-n-Tikka
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this disappointing hotel. We chose the hotel because of it's close proximity to the Tufts Dental School, but convenient location could not make up for the shortcomings. Our first night the room was uncomfortably cold and there were no extra blankets in the room. Apparently the hotel guests are assumed to have limited ability to operate a thermostat because ours did not respond to our attempts to adjust it. The second night we were given an old electric heater when we protested, but there was no convenient outlet in the room and magically the room was too warm the second night without it. Of course We were able to monitor the temperature of the room all night because we were kept awake by loud base-heavy music from the lounge in the lobby which seemed to resonate throughout the hotel. One final complaint which must be added; the room had a subtle but repulsive odor reminiscent of a sick-room. This may be a good venue for someone who wants to party the night away then collapse in a sub-standard room, but is certainly not a good choice if your evening plans include sleeping in a comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jayhawkinva
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the Theater District, the location is the best thing about this hotel. The easy access to entertainment venues, nightlife, restaurants, shopping and historic sights are the best things about this hotel. The overall hotel decor is clean, but really tired and dull. The room was small and had a very awkward layout. The bathroom was clean, but desperate for an update. The noise from the street and within the hotel made a restful sleep almost impossible even from the eighth floor! Next visit to Boston we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Way too noisy/pricey”
Reviews.Author: puff007NewEngland
Reviews.Content: First, the staff was excellent. Great customer service. That said, I'll likely be staying at a different hotel for my next stay. Rooms were small but clean. A handwritten letter under the door was a nice touch for my welcome. We were on the 10th floor and even that high, the street noise was too loud to sleep well. Breakfast was included in our room for one person and we paid for one person. It was a typical hotel breakfast, nothing fancy and for the price, I'd recommend elsewhere. Valet was $40 a night. So although the staff was nice and the rooms clean, the price point ($400), the extras and the noise level will lead me to change my next few reservations to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy to sleep”
Reviews.Author: DWSeekins
Reviews.Content: The point of a hotel is to sleep. No soundproofing here. Ambulances, crowd noise, horns, and slamming doors (they are designed this way) all night for several days. I was on the second highest floor so that does not help. Colleagues on other floors with the same problem. Room is small with a pedestal sink. There is a tiny shelf for toiletries not over the sink but over the toilet - you can guess what happens. The breakfast is OK but it is exactly what is offered at Residence Inn for free except you can get made to order omlettes. For $14.95, does not seem a good value. The staff was friendly, courteous, and prompt throughout the hotel. I am a regular Marriott fan but would not return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but only Average Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: There's a wide range of quality in the Courtyard brand and this hotel falls pretty much in the middle, not remarkably good nor remarkably bad. The guest rooms themselves are of a decent size, but furnished with the most basic and generic courtyard schemes, so once you're in the room, there's nothing to distinguish it from a room in Phoenix, Florida or anywhere else. The floor plan of our room set the bed close to the hallway door and the bathroom to the back, which isn't the best layout in terms of soundproofing; hence, we got a lot of hallway noise, and on the night we stayed there were quite a few partiers out and about. The lobby is gorgeous but I'd rather have a pokey lobby and gorgeous room than the other way around. Morning breakfast buffet is also cookie-cutter courtyard, a bit pricey for what you get but spot-on expected price range for a hotel breakfast. Don't get me wrong--- nothing really WRONG with this hotel, but I generally expect a bit more in terms of amenities or decor when a hotel is in a major city like Boston, and in the very high price range we paid. Location is great for theatre and clubbing, not so great if you'd like a quiet weekend away. The hotel's adjacent tapas restaurant turns into a weird sort of nightclub on the weekend, complete with the velvet rope, so if you're planning a return to the hotel during prime clubbing hours, be prepared to swim through the line of party-goers to get into the hotel. I would stay here again if the price were right--- sub-$200/night it's a great deal, but at our $300/night price point I didn't see the value. I do understand that Boston is an expensive city and that hotels can run quite high but we paid the identical rate the next night at the HIlton Financial District and felt the Hilton to be the far better value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TuppenceIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Good location, 10-15 minute walk to shops/harbour area and Boston common. Hotel nice and clean, good size room, good size bed and adequate storage space, no tea or coffee facilities in room but free facilities in hotel lobby. Free wifi in rooms. Only criticism was we could hear people next door who were rather loud, could almost hear every word so Walls were a bit thin and had to ask staff to come and tell them to be quiet! Friendly staff. I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: mcglamarous
Reviews.Content: Based on the previous reviews, we were apprehensive about staying in this hotel. However , we were placed in a room away from the street so there was very little noise even on Friday/Saturday night. Room was somewhat smaller but had king size bed and desk, no fridge and only stand up shower. This was sufficient for us. Room and bathroom was very clean and decor was modern. Location was 1/2 block from the T and close to several very good restaurants. Only about 3 blocks to Boston Common and Chinatown. We did get a reduced rate on priceline so did not pay retail for the three nights we stayed there. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not worth any stars!!!!”
Reviews.Author: b f
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of the worst hotels that I ever stayed at. The desk clerk was rude and arrogant.....(SL). He should be terminated by the Marriott. The room was NOT what was reserved and he advised us that we would take what we got!!!! The room was tiny...could barely walk around the bed. Our room had not been made up when we returned in the evening.The room had zero soundproofing. We could hear the woman in the next room sneeze!!..............NEVER WOULD I GO BACK HERE!!!! The security staff......(which we did require) was very helpful and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: tim1962
Reviews.Content: This is an old building converted into a modern hotel by an upscale, reliable brand (Marriott). You are in the downtown of a major, popular, busy, historic city so don't expect a brand new, fabulous, 5-star, luxurious room without paying dearly for it. This hotel is a good trade-off of location, amenities, and price. The configuration of any old city building like this one means that many rooms will lack a view. Rooms vary a lot in size. If you're a Marriott Rewards member, you should get a better room. If you reserve late and want the cheapest possible room, you may get a tiny room on a lower floor close to the street noise, with no view. That said, this was a nice hotel, quiet, clean, with good staff. Lobby is decorated in a theater style. I had the breakfast buffet once ($16) which was better than average quality for a hotel, but this is Boston so there's plenty of good places to eat. I am a longtime Marriott Rewards member, so i got a really nice room on the top (15th) floor. Stayed 3 nights. Room was quiet, large, and clean, with nice view of Back Bay. Bathroom was clean, everything worked well, and wife & i had plenty of room to spread out. Towels were thin and not what you usually get in a Marriott. Bed was excellent, had nice, clean linens and the assortment of pillows you usually get in a Marriott. Flatscreen TV. No microwave or fridge. Room, elevators, hallway smelled clean but there's little hints everywhere of wear and tear if you look closely. Location is a bit off the major tourist paths, but still in a good, safe area. It's right in the middle of the theater district, so all the shows and comedy clubs are within a couple of blocks. Very good pubs & restaurants (e.g. Rock Bottom, PF Chang's, and some locals) are one block north on Stuart. Just walk two blocks north on Tremont, and you're at Boston Common, and the Boylston station on the T (subway). This stop is on the green line so you can easily ride to all points west (Fenway Park, Prudential Center, Back Bay shopping, museums, BU, etc.), or go "inbound" to Government Center station in two stops and be in the middle of all the tourist destinations, Faneuil Hall, etc. or go on to North Station to TD Garden and from there take commuter trains to everywhere in Mass. Taxi from Logan runs about $20-25 and worth it since the hotel stiffs you $40/day for valet parking. You don't need a car here anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok”
Reviews.Author: travelnut2009
Reviews.Content: Room is tiny and just ok...framed picture in bathroom and floor has numerous long black hairs all over. Ick. Staff is very friendly but you can do way better. I don't love the location either.

Reviews.Title: “OK for what we needed it for”
Reviews.Author: jfulginiti
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Boston this weekend to attend an event and go out for the night. We really just needed a place to crash for the night and weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room. The room was small, older looking, and really smelled of bleach when we checked in. However, it was very clean and the beds were comfortable. If you are going to Boston on an extended vacation or plan to spend time in the room, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, small, smelly room with ZERO noise insulation!”
Reviews.Author: Erin_leigh79
Reviews.Content: Thankfully we pr!cel!ned this room, because it is in NO way worth the cost of paying the regular rate. Even at the low cost we paid I think I would have paid more to stay somewhere else. The room was exceptionally small and smelly (seriously, I volunteer at a nursing home and it smelled just like it!). I'd say it was smaller than our last few hotels in Paris, and if you've ever seen a small Paris hotel room you know what I'm saying. The location was fine, sure, but it's not like there aren't 50 other hotels in Boston with a great location. The room was dingy: the bathroom wall looked like someone had puked next to the toilet but the stains never got fully cleaned; the bathroom light switch was so dirty with the black gunk that collects in and around the switch itself like it's never been cleaned or replaced; TV was tiny, but next to it was a HUGE mirror that just looked really odd for a small room; we were not too bothered with the noise of the nightclub (this was a Sat. night stay) because the A/C covered it quite well, however our friends 2 doors down were next to a group of partying girls in an adjoining room who sounded like they were actually IN the room from the loud talking they could hear all night...we heard it, too, and I definately would have asked for a different room if I were nextdoor. The "concierge", if you can call him that, was terrible and basically didn't want to be bothered. We asked him about booking a Duck Tour and his response was, "oh, they are booked up this weekend, but you can use the computer around the corner to check". So, I asked him if he could call for us before we go online to see if there were any times open for us to book online (isn't that his job anyway?!) since he likely has a direct number for booking. So he picks up the phone and sure enough, "they are wide open; just show up down there". Great, glad you were so willing to help. Not. The lobby of this place is actually quite pretty, but this facade is exactly just that: a facade. Didn't try the restaurant, but the bell staff and valet were prettty swift and helpful. Would absolutely NOT stay here again. Worth another $50-$100 a night to stay somewhere more comfortable and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, old hotel”
Reviews.Author: tohhall
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here in a room booked by work. The room was small and not even up to Courtyard standards. There was no tub just a shower and while I don't usually bathe in hotel rooms it seemed cheap. The hotel is older and I got the sense that the location(downtown) means they could charge a little more and not worry about too many upgrades/improvements. That being said, the bed was comfortable, the room was clean,the shower was hot. It's close to the public garden, common, Beacon Hill and there is a parking lot and a T station right across the street. (hotel parking was $40 valet only-bit pricey). There appears to be a nightclub in the hotel and while I was waiting in the lobby it was really loud but I couldn't hear anything in my room.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most disappointing hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: goldengirl217
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011 for 2 nights. We have stayed at many Courtyard Marriott's and have come to know a standard level of quality. However, this hotel must have been missed by the quality control people at Marriott. The lobby and general areas are nice, so we figured it would be a standard hotel room. However, upon checking in, we found that our room was SO small. Barely room for 2 people and 2 beds. This is Boston, not NYC or Tokyo, so I was surprised at how small the rooms were. The bathroom was very small and outdated and did not have a bathtub, only a shower. The rooms appeared to be mostly clean but I did find a few hairs here and there. The most disappointing part of the room was the noise problem. We were in an adjoining room, and the door between the rooms appeared to be paper thin. We could hear the man next to us even when he was just speaking at normal level. He was up all night arguing with his partner on the phone, and every conversation we sat wide awake for - we know waaaay too much about this random's man love life and marital problems. We also were awakened at bar closing time due to large crowds and many sirens outside our windows. I honestly felt like we were in a bad movie staying at some dumpy motel. I couldn't believe that this room cost what it did and this is what it was. The location of the hotel is good and within walking distance of many other hotels. However, the price at this hotel was comparable to the Nine Zero hotel (actually the exact same) and we have stayed at the Nine Zero, and it is 1,000 times nicer. We used Marriott points for one night of our stay which is the only reason we stayed there, and I honestly can't believe people would pay $250 and up to stay at this hotel. Also, FYI, parking is $40 a night, which is high even by Boston standards. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great city”
Reviews.Author: CT-Travler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on Sunday night of Labor Day weekend. Booked the hotel on Priceline and I highly recommend it. Arrived at the hotel around 10:30am and the hotel had a room available so I was able to check in early. Huge room with two full size beds, flat screen TV, desk and chair. Faced Tremont Street so had a great view too. The location is Tremont Street right off Stuart. Location is one of the best things about the hotel. Located a super short walk from everything including all of the downtown theaters (which surround the hotel), Newbury Street, the Boston Common, Chinatown, Washington Street shopping, and even the North End (Little Italy). If you prefer public transportation there are T stops about 2 blocks from the hotel. The hotel itself looked like it was a renovated historic building. And no the hotel did not show any signs of its age. Used the valet parking service - was $40 (I think) for the night and you could keep the car with the valet until 2pm the day you check out. The only minor problem I faced was that the hotel is across from a public parking garage. I was on the Tremont St side of the hotel (I think the 6th floor) and there are large and somewhat rowdy crowds that gather outside the parking garage when the bars let out and everyone returns back to their cars to head home to the suburbs early in the morning. The police are outside to manage the crowds and this is really the only minor problem I had my entire stay. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Street”
Reviews.Author: threecows
Reviews.Content: Had to go to Boston for a wedding this hotel was on our list from the Bride and Groom took this on price alone. Read all the reviews on Trip Advisor decided to stay there as it didn't get the best reviews. The hotel is in a fantastic spot for walking. The main shopping area is only a block away Lots of history all walking distance. The room we had was fantastic, large and clean . Room on 8th floor facing the street, very noisey asked to change rooms no hesitation by the staff to change our room, only complaint was we didn't get the same type of room, it was smaller and no LCD TV had an old tellie. Fantastic bar down the road called The Tam, great waitress called Lyn,she made our stay in Boston one to remember.Lots of nightclubs in the area but didn't hear the noise but saw what goes on when they all get kicked out at 2.30 in the morning What sight had a ball watching the police control all the drunks, there wasn't any fighting all merry enjoyed watching everything.Would recommend this hotel it your if your not a prude, I and my husband are "50 plus bracket."

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, noisy.”
Reviews.Author: JackFlynn
Reviews.Content: Pros - Good location. The lobby has a small store where you can get beer, soda, chips, and a few other things 24/7. The hotel has a nice restaurant and lounge. Free internet. Cons- Noisy.Room entry doors slam all night long. The rooms are very small. Our windows were very dirty. Overall, the hallways felt like they needed a good cleaning. No refrigerator in the room. No coffee in the room. (There was a pot, but only 1 setup for decaf). $40 valet parking. (In fairness though, that's the going rate in any large city.) Overall, we could live with the small rooms and lack of amenities, but the noise kept us from getting a decent nights sleep. Stay away if possible.

Reviews.Title: “let down :-(”
Reviews.Author: JE1205
Reviews.Content: We are actually staying here right now and not happy with it at all. The room is incredibly small, dingy and somewhat dirty. I had called twice about having a small refridgerator available in the room and yet despite all the assurances I received- it wasn't there. Today they finally delivered one, and thank god I had enough ice and paks in the cooler to keep medication cool. Had we not been so totally completely exhausted I would have said something yesterday, but I'm not sure what this hotel can do besides move us to another equally small, dingy room. I plan on speaking with management about this because we are not happy AT ALL and since the plan is to be staying here for nearly another two weeks I am actively looking at checking in to one of the other hotels in the area. It's disappointing- Marriott has always been our go-to hotel chain :-(.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, thin walls, odor, no control of heat/air”
Reviews.Author: doughboy41
Reviews.Content: Good location if you need to have access to conference at Four Seasons for instance. And, you get Marriott Rewards points. Other than that there is no reason to stay here. Dingy rooms, musty odor as if had been smoked in long ago, you can't control room temp (hotel decides what is comfy for all the rooms), the walls and/or door for sharing rooms so thin I could hear the person next to me as if my room was a suite and they were in the living room. TV wasn't working in my room, either (sound but no picture) but conveniently it was only a one night stay so I didn't bother with it. For me, this is a never again hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - VERY small room”
Reviews.Author: Morrsue
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old building - very nice lobby area. Excellent location, easy to get to from the airport. Unfortunately my room was so small I had to leave and go to a different location. I felt so claustrophobic but if you can tolerate it, the rooms were clean and nicely decorated. I don't like having such a small bathroom, and there was a wardrobe "box" where I expected a closet. My business suits were all squished in there - not good. The front desk staff was very helpful, cheery and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Decent option”
Reviews.Author: corpkid
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty basic Courtyard (yes, some of the more recently renovated ones are pretty darned good!). But this is an older version. It's comfortable, and it works, but the rooms are small and limited-service. The location is good right near the park and the trains. There is also the theaters right there if you are in town for that. I stay here when I go "home" to visit my brothers who live in Boston. I find the rates and location to be the best deal most times. Overall, the rooms are clean, but dated and VERY small. But it's in the heart of the city so what do you expect? The staff has been attentive and polite in my experience, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Placed”
Reviews.Author: Emool
Reviews.Content: First impression were good, greeting on arrival very friendly and helpful. As we had arrived late in evening suggested a few places we could eat nearby. it was situated just down from Boston Common- handy for start of Freedom Trail. Room good size , very clean, ideal for short stay. Good buffet breakfast and reseaonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleFlo
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be ideal. The rooms were large, bed comfortable and clean. I had read some negative reports about this hotel but I was very pleased with what I experienced. The staff were helpful and friendly. The location being in the Theatre area was good and I felt very safe at all times. You were only a short walk from Boston Common which was great and it also led to some lovely places for a meal/drink, especially Cheers!. I had noted a comment about noise so as a precaution I had taken some ear plugs. I did use them and was never really troubled by noise at night time. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FENNERBUF
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The hotel is on the edge of Chinatown and in the theater district, and is a short walk to the subway. There are plenty of bars and restaurants close by. The rooms are average, but the hotel itself is beautiful. The lobby and common areas are very ornate and are true to the hotel's grand origins. Parking is paid only. Valet service is available for $40 a day (added onto the room bill). Some of the local ramps are cheaper, but not as convenient. Be warned that the room rate does not include the numerous taxes and fees for the city, state etc., which drives the cost per night up some. Ask when booking for the "actual" cost per night.

Reviews.Title: “Typical city hotel”
Reviews.Author: KubaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've used this hotel for one night during the business trip in Boston. The hotel is pretty nice, the staff were friendly and professional, check-in,out very fast. The location is ok for all main attractions of the city, because almost everything is within walking distance. Many bars, pubs, restaurants nearby. The standard of room, cleanliness and service were good, however the rooms are a little bit small. The bathroom nice and clean. Good air-conditioning. The breakfest not included in the room rate but it was pretty good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy....but this is one of my favorites!”
Reviews.Author: AudgeSanAntonioTexas
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel because of the fact it is right next to China town and in the Theater district. I am from San Antonio, Texas which is a very small city compared to Boston and I always felt safe. People say China town is scary and dangerous, but I never felt scared. I didn't stay out past 10pm, but I did walk around after dark. I love to get Bubble Tea in China Town as well as visiting the cute little Asian markets. The hotel itself was very nice. My two requirements are clean and safe....and this was exactly that...clean and safe. The staff was super friendly as well. I would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Lots of sizzle, but the steak was a bit undercooked”
Reviews.Author: BizTooMuch
Reviews.Content: This hotel's common rooms (eg. lobby) were absolutely beautiful. It has a historic feel, but it's all beautifully updated. However, once you get to your room, you may be less than "wowed". As with any city room, they are on the smallish side. The sheets and towels were subpar - even for a Courtyard. The breakfast buffett offered a huge variety and was delish. A nice safety feature is that you need your key card to get onto your room floor. I'm an Elite member, so I got a room on the top floor, & my room had some sunlight, but my colleague's room on the 11th floor seemed like a glorified college dorm room. There was a "pop up" concierge lounge with a wine reception on Wednesday night in the 15th floor lobby. I took taxis everywhere, but the location seemed convenient - it's in the Theater district and seemed to have amenities. The hit of the trip was the Encore lobby bar - came back from a work dinner with a colleague and we had a great time listening to a karoake night of seemingly professional singers... a fun time not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: dunavriver
Reviews.Content: This hotel at a walking distance of the main attractions: Boston Common Park, Beacon Hill, The Freedom Trail... You don't need public transportaton at all. It is nice and clean, the beds are very comfortable and the bathroom spacious. It is a good idea to get a room + parking package. My only objection: no wifi access in the guestrooms.

Reviews.Title: “We WISH we could have stayed - but Marriott cancelled our reservation on the day we were to check in!”
Reviews.Author: DanvilleMike
Reviews.Content: We booked a reservation through United Mileage Plus for the Courtyard Marriott Downtown for my mother-in-law and son. The day before they were to arrive in Boston we called United to let them know that they would be a day late arriving by Amtrak due to weather in the Northern U.S. Mileage Plus claims they called Marriott to ensure the room would still be available upon their arrival a day late. Two days later, the day they were to finally arrive in Boston, I got an email at 3PM Pacific time telling me that Marriott had cancelled the reservation and would not reinstate it. I had to scramble to find a hotel in Boston with no notice. I was finally able to find one in Quincy, 10 miles outside of downtown and not ideal for them. In talking with United Mileage Plus, they claim they called Marriott and it isn't their fault that Marriott cancelled the reservation. In talking to David Chen, the manager of the Courtyard Marriott Downtown, he informed me it is Marriott's policy to hold a hotel room if they are notifed a guest will be late, but that the hotel wasn't notified. I'm very frustrated with both United and Marriott because neither is willing to accept any responsibility for this obvious mistake. Someone screwed up and a senior citizen and 14-year old were almost left stranded in Boston. I'm would certainly not recommend staying at this hotel because they didn't even attempt to help me with this situation. For that matter, good luck with Marriott in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: niviapr
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent. The rooms are ok, on the small side, but $40 for parking is not acceptable and no WiFi, don't pay more that 75.00 and you will feel very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: goldboar
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Tremont is your typical Courtyard hotel, a no none sense functional hotel with a the Marriott touch. Located in Downtown Boston it is convenient to many of things you go to Boston for, close to Boston Common and the Freedom Trail. The hotel is located in the theater district. The hotel is clean and has all of the amenities needed. Didn't spend a lot of time in the room because of business obligations. Staff is courteous and willing to help. As with other Courtyards, no room service and limited restaurant facilities, mainly breakfast. There is a bar connected to the hotel for a after dinner drink. Hotel rates are comparable to others in area, reasonable. I've stayed there twice this year and will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodations with spacious hotel rooms in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: WeSawIt
Reviews.Content: We spent the 4th of July weekend here because the hotel indicated they could accommodate our party of 6 in one room. We were very impressed with the size of our room. We had lots of space for everyone and our luggage. We had a great big closet to hold most of our things. Because this is a Courtyard Marriott, they did not have concierge, full service dining or room service - which was fine with us since we knew this when we booked. A really nice touch was the free morning coffee they made available in the lobby every morning and also the fresh drinking water in the afternoon - it may seem like a minute detail, but trust me when I say that my kids loved coming back to the hotel after a day of sightseeing to help themselves to citrus or cucumber water. The location was also great as we walked almost everywhere. We never needed our car. The hotel also gave great recommendations for nearby dining. We were never disappointed. The fitness center isn't very large, but I never had a problem finding free equipment to workout. I only wish they had a pool.

Reviews.Title: “A bit hectic”
Reviews.Author: scmama29
Reviews.Content: I wish we would have researched the different neighborhoods before choosing the Theatre district. More on the neighborhood later, but first let me discuss the hotel. Very busy, loud inside and outside the hotel. The way the building is designed you can hear people talking outside on the streets. Yes this is downtown people, and its hard to sleep at night from all the sirens and crowds in the night. The rooms itself were ok, the decor was outdated but the beds were fairly comfortable. The lobby and the elevators are very crowded. Be prepared to wait a while for one to come and bring you up to your floor. They have valet parking and you should use it, and yes it is expensive. However the guys are pretty good at remembering your car after a couple of days. Now the neighborhood. Old, dirty, crowded, and loud. Close to the park, but couldn't go there for peace and quiet because of the beggers. In fact they were pretty bad all over in this neighborhood . Everywhere we went someone was hitting us up for money. Your within walking distance to Cheers but be prepared for a long walk. Well worth it to get out of this neighborhood. Your also within walking distance to China Town, but its not very big. I would avoid this area alltogether unless you are their for the shows only. There was one neat German bar a couple doors down from this hotel. I just assume stay there the whole time and drink wine.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on How Much You Pay”
Reviews.Author: cj878
Reviews.Content: As a Priceline customer, I felt this hotel was a pretty good deal for a Boston weekend. If I had paid the hotel's internet rate of $279 for that night, it would be a different story altogether. I would also say that it does not seem like a solid three-star. On the positive side, the front desk reception team are really courteous and helpful. I also found the location to be good for getting around to other neighborhoods. When I got into my room, however, I definitely had the old hotel feeling, and not in the good sense of the term. I disagree that the beds are great because mine felt sort of sponge-y and unpleasantly bouncy. The pillows were somewhat lumpen. The bathroom seemed very basic, but everything was in good working order. The only major negative during my stay was the front door valet, who hurled my suitcase wheels-first into the trunk of the cab with such force that it seemed the wheels of the luggage would be damaged.

Reviews.Title: “Eeek!”
Reviews.Author: windsor90
Reviews.Content: We are platinum marriott customers and stay in all kinds all over all the time. I simply cannot believe the condition of this hotel. It is by far the worst that we have experienced in a very long time. The staff is lovely and makes up for what the hotel lacks. Our first room, before we were moved, was not much bigger than the king sized bed. The reason we moved was because it was too small and.... the a/c filter door was open and before closing it we took a look inside. Literally, the filter looked like a fur coat it was that covered in dust. I can't even imagine how many years it has been since the filter was changed. It might seem minor but it is a direct indication of how the property has been maintained. I just couldnt sleep with my daughter in a bed next to that vent blowing dust with who knows what else floating around in it. The next room's filter was just as coated but this time it was located in a living room area. So we put up with it. The rooms both smelled bad and were covered up by some hotel room deodorizer. We spent as much time as possible out of the room it was that depressing. The rooms are in desperate need of revamping. It's simply tired and run down. I did read the reviews before coming to this hotel. We didn't have time to figure out another arrangement. I was hoping for the best but sadly everyone on this thread is right! I will be contacting Marriott....this hotel is a disgrace to the Marriott consistency that we have grown to rely on. I feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: SendMeSomewhere
Reviews.Content: Just checked in here and let me say this place is disgusting-I'm here with my mom and we requested double beds, didn't get them. Got to the room and it is tiny-no room to even put a bag. Hot as heck and when icalled for a temperature adjustment they offered to being up a fan. It's dirty everywhere inclunding curtains and floor-which is the only place we can put our bags. I'm going to try to find an alternative but please learn from our experience and do not stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “When in town, staying elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Klte11
Reviews.Content: We booked three months ahead for two connecting double rooms plus fold-away in one. Didn't get it, in fact rooms were on different floors (we're a family)! Rooms were not cleaned until late in day, glasses were not replaced, etc. The one good aspect was the beds were very comfortable. Staff were very friendly but we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: bellum1202
Reviews.Content: We stay at Marriott hotels wherever we go and this one was nice but wasn't as nice as we expected. The location is on the edge of the main Boston attractions (in the theater/chinatown neighborhood), so no matter what we were doing it was at least a 4-5 block walk. The room itself was a bit of a let down. We had a corner room on the top floor but it was still pretty small. The closet door was barely functioning, the make-up mirror hinges were broke, the bathroom light looked like it was a replacement and they didn't fill in the holes from the original one, no bathroom exhaust fan, and the air conditioning didn't do a great job of keeping the room cool and left it feeling rather damp. On the positive, the bed was very comfortable and the linens were great. The elevators are super efficient and the front desk staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mmp59
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the previous reviews but my concerns were unfounded. We booked on Priceline and had a room on the 7th floor. Yes, the room and the bathroom were small but for one night, not a problem. For size of the room, a queen bed would have given a little more room. But as at all Marriott properties, the bed was super comfortable and the shower great. The location is perfect-close to both Green and Orange line. Near Boston Common, across the street from the Wang Center and other theaters. We did not experience any noise problems at all. Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. Rock Bottom Brewery nearby on Stuart Street had great food.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not spend your night here on weekends/festivities”
Reviews.Author: The_Roosters
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not be under Marriott portfolio, it's probably one of the worst night spent into a hotel and it's very sad to say that because it's extremely well located, it allows you to visit Boston by walk and right in front of the hotel you have the stop of one of the trolleys that ride all around the city. So overall we can say great location during the day and strategic for visiting the city; but during the night it's another story!! A Night club is right attached to the hotel, you also have a direct access from the lounge and you can hear the music from the 15th floor! Security seems not existing and rooms (old and not in really nice shape) are not soundproof at all so you can hear everything from corridors to next room.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was living back in a military barracks!”
Reviews.Author: nomad1155
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel ever!!! I stay all over Boston and the country. I've stayed at a Motel 6 better than this place. About the only thing it has going for it is the Lobby. The bathrooms might as well be a porta john. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “very loud, very small, worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: anonymous12360763
Reviews.Content: It's located in a "clubby" area which is cool if that's what you're into. But our rooms are very tiny and the walls are paper thin. My friends in the room over could hear us whispering and could recite our conversation verbatim... which was actually about the conversation the room across from us. Paper thin walls- unbelievable. And the club on the 3rd floor was still loud and pounding on the 6th floor where we stayed. If you are a crazy party type this is your spot but if you're not avoid this place like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Krischad
Reviews.Content: Hotel had very small, very out-dated rooms. Windows are locked closed. Air conditioning inadequate. Bathrooms are poor, with only shower and small sink. Above all the beds were bad And television was off to the side of the room, hard to view from bed. This hotel is way overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on u Marriott”
Reviews.Author: NYSHotels
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, no wireless Internet, bathrooms were small. If you are taller then 5 feet 8 inches, you will have to duck down to get your hair wet. Shower heads are low. No bath tubs. TV are small. Plus 40 dollars a day to park your car. They do have hard wired Internet. They do not have safe in a room. Shame on you Marriott. Should atleast have a wireless Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: gabyrd80
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good but rooms were very small and noisy. It is located in a great area close to the theaters and the Boston Opera. It also has bars and restaurants close by...so close that one is actually inside the hotel (nothing against it) but if you are trying to get a good night sleep then you won't be able until the bar closes at 2AM. Staff was friendly and rooms were clean. Good place to stay if you don't mind the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Check past reviews - OK place, with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: bizzyinvt
Reviews.Content: First - for the sake of transparency - I "pricelined" this hotel. So we were paying well below rack rate, and the rate of other hotels in the area. We were in Boston celebrating our anniversary. I priocelined this hotel and after our "bid"was accepted found the other reviews here on Trip Advisor. The positives: This is a hotel that is smack dab in the middle of the theater district, so the location is great. Relatively easy to get to. Two blocks away, and you are at the corner of the Commons, and the "T". I talked with the front desk prior to our arrival to see if we could get a higher floor, and possibly get away from the noise we had read about in other reviews. The staff was very accomodating and helped us out. Every interaction we had with the staff was positive - maybe not outstanding, but very cordial, very personable. Other reviewers had talked about the small size of the rooms. Yes, ours was small, but for two of us, it was fine, and we were very comfortable. The negatives There was a lot of ambient noise, mostly from outside the hotel. During the night, there were several times where sirens outside could be clearly heard from outside. Also, early on Sunday morning, work out on the street woke us up. I know the hotel can not control what is happening in a city outside the property, but the sound came easily into the rooms. I am a very sound sleeper and was woken a couple of times during the night. This is an older hotel that has been renovated a couple of times. And some of the details are worn. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Yes, but I would make sure they knew of all of the things we encountered - good and bad.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it.”
Reviews.Author: NHtraveler64
Reviews.Content: I am glad I didn't listen to all the bad reviews. I almost changed our reservation because of the worst hotel/never stay again reviews. We stayed one night on the eighth floor with two kids. The room was very pleasant and bigger than expected for a city hotel. The noise was the usual city noise. We did not hear the night club. It was Thursday night. The staff was friendly. The location is excellent especially if you are going to the theater. The subway is a short walk. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst marriott I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: getafiz
Reviews.Content: I'm a marriott regular for business travel and this is by far the worst Marriott I've stayed at. The rooms are dated. Bathroom is tiny without any significant counter space - as a result the maid broke my cologne when she was cleaning the bathroom. The front desk rarely answers the phone - there was a fire alarm at 2am and we all walked out in our PJs and waited for a good ten minutes and could see that it was a false alarm. I call the front desk to confirm and nobody answers. Had to go down in my PJs to confirm. There is no wireless.. have to stay tethered to the wire at the desk. The room has a weird orientation where the TV is to the right of the beds.. so no convenient way of sitting on your bed and watching TV in front of you. anyway.. long and short is that it was the worst marriott I've stayed at and makes me wonder why I prefer marriott for my business travel. My colleagues stayed at the Millennium Bostonian and were very happy with their experience for the same price. Tip: If you do end up staying here, try Via Matta nearby for great italian food.

Reviews.Title: “My next trip to Boston won't be spent here”
Reviews.Author: PhillyEC
Reviews.Content: Two things: I never write reviews and I love Marriotts. This is the first unpleasent experience I've had staying at one. First off, they refused to turn AC on inside the rooms. They only air conditioned the common areas. It was a warm weekend and our room was uncomfortable and humid from the moment we walked in....and showering with no exhaust fans only worsened the situation. They also said since we had a room on the "noisy" side of the hotel, the windows would not open. Great! Secondly, there is a CLUB in the hotel. Now, I'm a partyer but going into that place would've had me scared of a shooting. Just saying. The entire lobby was thumping and I later realized our room on the 8th floor was as well. Third on my list, the guy on the other side of the connecting room who we could hear more than clearly talking on his phone. It felt quite un-private. All in all, the room was TIGHT, the bathroom was old and I will definitely pay more to stay elsewhere next time. BUT, I will say we had a good brunch with a made-to-order omlette on our last day. Score!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of BOOM BOOM BOOM!!”
Reviews.Author: tpeters13
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here if you plan on going to bed before 2am, the club next door was very loud!!

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: smlk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel @ Priceline. I got good price. Room was very small, bathroom samll and no vanity. It was quite hard to put our stuff in the bathroom. I used towel racks to place my shaving cream and other items. Room was smellly. The only good thing was $. Front desk staff was pleasant to deal with. I needed change for parking and they were very happy to help. Don't park at the hotel. It costs $40 a night. Boston Common Garage is at a walking distance and you can park there for just $11. I recomend that Courtyard should improve the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment in many ways”
Reviews.Author: N2NY
Reviews.Content: Booked via Priceline and I suspect that's why we received a room adjacent to the staff elevator, where housekeeping banged their carts against our wall starting at 7a.m. Housekeeping also entered the room to clean when we had a "do not disturb" sign up and made the bed with an obviously dirty pillowcase (blech) and could barely speak English. Internet in the room did not work. The bathroom was dark and cold. The towels were cheap. The bed was uncomfortable and the heater was noisy. There was no dresser in the room. $40 valet parking!?! Aside from housekeeping, however, the staff was friendly and helpful. Boy, would I have been upset had I paid anything close to this hotel's $180 weekday rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “A bit off standard for a Courtyard Marriot”
Reviews.Author: DCMANYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night during the week for business. The location is okay but not great - depends where you need to be. I was surprised at how old the hotel was. My room was teeny tiny and smelled somewhat dank. The bathroom was a bit moldy and the wallpaper was peeling. Nothing was terribly awry but the room could have used some renovation. The price was right, though, so at least you didn't feel like you were being overcharged for a ho hum property. I don't expect glittery glamor at the Courtyard but I would have thought it would be a bit more shined up.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: keb0218
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in town for my birthday so my fiance booked this hotel on priceline for only $60 (which we thought was a great deal!) The location of the hotel is great and even the room was okay (small TV, small bathroom) but we weren't expecting much given what we paid. They put us on the 6th floor and we got back to the hotel around midnight after dinner. The noise from the nightclub was awful. It felt like our room was vibrating and when that finally ended at 2am a group of loud, obnoxious party-goers turned the hallway outside of our bedroom into another party zone. They were yelling, running up and down the halls, slamming doors and fighting. We called the hotel front desk twice and finally at 4am they removed them from the premise. Why a hotel would put a large group like this together on the same floor is beyond me as it's only a recipe for disaster. We talked to the manager at the hotel in the morning and she was very nice and very apologetic and rectified the situation for us, I will give them credit for that. My only other complaint is that it seems when you book through priceline they give you the worst rooms, as other people have said the same thing about their rooms when booked through priceline so I would be aware of that!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and not the NIGHTMARE others would have you believe”
Reviews.Author: rachelkyle
Reviews.Content: I was timid to go to this hotel after several reviews I read. However I would like to say that I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked the hotel. It is not new and it is not fancy (so if you are looking for those things this is not the hotel for you). For me however this hotel was perfect. I needed a nice clean place to stay for me and my husband as we went away for Valentine's Day weekend. The room is small and there is no bathtub in the bathroom...but the beds were clean and there was adequate space for our clothing, luggage, and any items we purchased. No there wasn't a refrigerator, which would have been nice, but that wasn't something we required (for drinks you can always use the ice bucket). The location on Tremont St was convenient to restaurants, Starbucks, and the T (Tufts Medical Center). Using Tremont St (which is a fairly central street in Boston) made getting around easy and we didn't have any trouble being able to get back to our hotel. At no time did I feel uncomfortable or that the area was unsafe. I would recommend this hotel to ANYONE coming to visit Boston. We were lucky enough to get the hotel through Priceline, by naming our own price (we stayed for 42% off of the listed rate of $129). Hopefully you will not allow the poor reviews of others to sway you away from this wonderful little find :) On a note about the courteous staff: We were kindly greeted and when we had an issue with our room it was promptly taken care of and we were given another room (the room we were assigned was a bit noisy, an air conditioning unit was outside of our window) without any trouble. I just can't say enough about this hotel and would gladly look forward to visiting again on a future visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad4040
Reviews.Content: This is a great Courtyard, located right downtown with plenty to do within walking distance. The staff was great. My only complaint is no wireless in the rooms. I will stay here again on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine at the Tremont Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: ccolette
Reviews.Content: Not too much to say - the hotel is a 3* and I think it is a 3*. Room was pretty and small. Had a new flat screen tv with HBO and nice bathroom. The wardrobe was a little bulky in the room but ok. I was able to adjust temp (windchill -35 degrees in Boston that week!). Found the front desk really helpful every time I asked a questions. Business center on the 15th floor was perfect to hold my impromptu meeting. I refused to park in valet ($40!!!) and parked on the street (free after 6pm-8am) and just used the meters until I left. Good coffee in lobby. Overall - not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Short notice stay due to inclement weather”
Reviews.Author: jp222jp
Reviews.Content: Made last minute plans to stay in town after seeing Jersey Boys. Thanks to recommendation warning of Friday evening noise, I booked a room requesting HIGH floor. That solved the problem. Positives - Location: Was able to walk to evening dinner and event. Negatives - Valet parking a bit pricy. Room size was fine with two doubles.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there on a Friday or Saturday night!”
Reviews.Author: Chiqadee
Reviews.Content: 3 VERY LOUD nightclubs in this building.....the younger crowd lines up outside the main entrance area on Friday and Saturday nights, and from 10 pm to 2 am the bass thumps the entire building. I was on the 9th floor and had to move to the 11th floor and still had the noise. The crowds are rowdy and unruly.....fights broke out.....cops were there....at 2am hundreds of partiers literally come streaming out of the clubs. Between the club goers and the sirens, the bass thumping and any others partying on your floor, you can kiss a good nights sleep goodbye. That said, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are very nice and the whole hotel is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Prison cell of a room”
Reviews.Author: Badbreath
Reviews.Content: slow elevators, peuk yellow finishes, and a massive desk wedged into a broom closet of a room. thermostat out of reach above a wardrobe in a hot and stuffy room. good breakfast in the cafe, but at $12 it further erodes the value of staying here - I wouldn't take a free room off my Marriott pointst there - I'm a Gold and it's a dump. I could tell by the clerk's reaction when I said "old building?" as I checked in that he received negative comments on the state of the place. Oh, and $40 for parking - if I had needed a car, I'd have been pissed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: hastres
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Courtyard Downtown in Boston in early September 2010 for 2 nights. We stayed here using a family member's Marriott discount, so we got the room for a total of $120 which was a great deal during the peak summer months. The location is great in every way! We flew into Logan airport and then took a taxi to the hotel. Even though our flight arrived around 5pm on a Tuesday, the cab ride was maybe 20-25 minutes door-to-door. The hotel itself is located in the theater district 1 block from the Tufts Medical Center.
