There is easy access public transit (bus and subway stops are within easy walking distance) and the hotel is also about 2 blocks S of Boston Common. The rooms are what you expect from a hotel in the downtown area of a major city; SMALL! Seriously the room has the look and feel of an oversized closet with a window, but it worked great for us (when you're on vacation how much time do you spend in the room anyway?) The room had been recently redone, with modern fixtures/amenities and was very clean. The bed was nice and soft and the bathroom was spacious and clean also which are both a huge PLUS. The front desk staff was quite helpful with suggestions on where to eat and also had easy directions on where to catch mass transit. Although the hotel advertises to business travelers, it was very tourist friendly and we will consider staying there again on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but in need of some updates.”
Reviews.Author: mjmarshpa
Reviews.Content: It is a decent place. The location, in the theatre district is great and it is very close to just about all of city and state government. The hotel is fine but don't expect a typical Marriott courtyard this is much more like an older, classic downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and small but otherwise ok”
Reviews.Author: mgburdett
Reviews.Content: We were put here by Priceline and paid $84 a night, and for that price I was satisfied with my experience. If I had paid the price on other sites at that time (~160) I would be very disappointed with the place. Cons= - VERY noisy, the night clubs were very loud and even 8 floors up you could hear the bass thumping and the drunk people on the street yelling . Also seemed to be a lot of sirens, whether this is from the hospital in the area or crime in the area I'm not sure. You could also hear a lot from neighboring rooms- not just loud noises I'm talking about hearing other conversations and even the crinkling of a plastic shopping bag would carry through the walls. Also the doors have very heavy/resistant hinges and shut very hard which produced a lot of noise too. Thankfully I had some ear plugs with me, but still had some issues. - room is very small, especially the bath room. The sink is stand alone, and the only shelving is a small 3 tiered rack that hangs above the toilet. Two people getting ready in the room is a challenge. Pros: - price paid - room and lobby was clean - every employee we encountered was very nice - location is pretty good, can get to subway (both orange and green line) very quick, but close to Chinatown which I've heard is an area to avoid at night. (at least according to Frommer's)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is two blocks from Boylston subway station, two blocks from Boston Common and an easy walk to the Prudential Centre and Newbury Street. It is also walkable to Quincy Market area. Everything is within reach. Having said that, the rooms are not large, and the cleaning in the bathroom could have done with the "hotel inspector's" touch to it. It wasn't dirty, but just wasn't as spotless as you'd hope for. There is free wired internet in the rooms, and free coffee in the lobby. The first room I was given faced into a central area, where there was a lot of noise from an air ventilation outlet or something similar. I asked to be moved, and despite being on the lowest hotel floor (6th), I still had a fine view over the Back Bay. I obtained the booking at the hotel through Priceline's Name Your Price option - it was around $130 per night.

Reviews.Title: “There are no words.....”
Reviews.Author: msiwbh
Reviews.Content: hmm...where to begin! Like others have said-the rooms are very small and our t.v. was mounted near the window so trying to watch it was pretty comical! There are 2 nightclubs right next to the hotel and the music is pumping ALL NIGHT! Not joking-from around 10 till 2 a.m. there was no chance of trying to fall asleep! Earplugs should be given out at check-in! I felt dirtier after taking a shower because of the smell the towels had to them! We brought our own fan because of the other reviews-and thank goodness we did! The hallways are cool and the rooms are sweltering! The one plus to the hotel was that the Orange line was extremely close....but thats about it! If you notice-Marriott has removed it's name from this hotel on some sites....what does that tell you???

Reviews.Title: “eh...not bad but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: Not a big fan of courtyards in general but this one was well below their average. Location isn't bad if you want to poke around the Back Bay section of Boston. But not exactly in the heart of anything (just off the beaten path). Rooms were small. Bathrooms TINY (pocket door and it was still tight). Carpets in common areas brand new so it isn't bad or really beat up or anything....just nothing to write home about. But if your purpose is an inexpensive way to see Boston it will do that for you. I prefer the Lenox and if you look most times the price isn't that much more (but the experience is considerably better....albeit without any "points" if that matters to you). Safe enough, though

Reviews.Title: “Sweat Stained Pillow”
Reviews.Author: macabi
Reviews.Content: The entrance to the hotel was dirty with gum residue and cigarette buts. The foyer floor had not been polished in months. The carpet in the elevator was filthy. I requested a room change when I inspected the pillows on the bed and saw the sweat stains. The replacement room had no bathtub, but a shower stale with the drain cover coming off when by toe touched it. Terrible nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “No way, too expensive and not at all rest-material”
Reviews.Author: anna110488
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go on a business trip I chose a hotel to sleep and rest in. This one was offered by the show I was attending but it was horrible. I thought "Marriott means good quality" but absolutely not. First, we arrived very late [past midnight] and when we got to our room it was two doubles, so we called in and asked for a king size [i went with my husband] and they moved us [which was ok] BUT the real problem began... it was IMPOSSIBLE to sleep!!!!!! There were compressors buzzing the WHOLE night!! I had an early meeting at the show and didn't sleep AT ALL!!!!!!! We asked to be moved from the room but they told us next morning they would, and they gave us the SMALLEST room ever. I would NEVER EVER book this hotel again... the room was small, the towels were old and seemed dirty, the bathroom had mold - VERY OLD very ugly It was a horrible experience.. i thank god it was just for 2 nights..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Kikib02
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have gotten a better location. Blocks away from Newbury street, the public garden and beacon hill. Right in the heart of the theater district. Friendly staff, clean rooms, free, good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Gr8_FamilyAdventures
Reviews.Content: This hotel and our larger, accessible, king room was great for the $100 price we paid. If we paid full price for a regular sized king room I would be giving it 2/5. Overall it was clean and comfortable. Rooms have a small fridge and corded free internet, though we couldn't get ours to work and after 20 mins. trying to work it out by phone with staff, we gave up. I would stay again if I was guaranteed the larger room for the same price. Tip: on the weekend park down the road under the common at the Boston Common Garage for $11 in after 4pm, out by 8am. Save a few bucks on weeknights at the Tufts garage across the street--$30 up to 12 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott name does not guarantee quality”
Reviews.Author: onlinela
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel because it was listed as a participating hotel for a medical convention. I booked a double--had confirmation to prove it--but when I checked in (my family came with me), only kings were available. The desk personnel made a big show that they would get me an "accessible" room, meaning handicapped accessible, supposedly bigger than their standard king. Why I didn't get the room I reserved was never explained. After waiting more than an hour for the "accessible" room, we were shown to a tiny room--not "accessible"--there were no characteristic grab bars, and the bathroom door was too narrow for a wheelchair, so I suspect the front desk made up the "accessible" story to keep us from complaining. The room was so small you could hardly walk around the bed. The bed itself was supremely uncomfortable, with a poor mattress and lumpy pillows. Bath towels were thin, more like dish towels. All this for over $200/night. Boston is expensive, I wish I'd paid more for a decent room, we would have had a much more comfortable visit. The only reason this rated two stars was for location and cleanliness. GO ELSEWHERE!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler28970
Reviews.Content: My company booked this hotel for 3 days at 240+++/night and I have certain expectations from Marriott hotels. This hotel is NOT worth the money. Hotel room was old, bathroom was small (could not use sink without having to first close the bathroom door), outdated and not that clean. There was no counter space in the bathroom and it took over 5 minutes for the shower to run "hot" water. The rugs in my room were "okay" but in the hall and elevator they were old, dirty and stained. The mini refrigerator was ripped out and there was no room safe. Bed was mostly comfortable and I was able to adjust the room temperature. These are my only 2 positives. I also had a problem with taxes added to my bill that I am still trying to resolve. Staff were "friendly" but no one could actually fix or explain the problem with my bill; they just keep sending me to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Lolaloo22
Reviews.Content: Let me start my review by saying that I did NOT pay full price for this room. We got it for $80 a night on priceline last minute. The rate for the same night on their website was $199 (it was Labor Day weekend, not sure if that made it more or less expensive). That being said, it was a great hotel for the price and we would stay here again for $80. I would not have stayed here for the full room rate. Make sure you check priceline before booking. Hotel was easy to find. Valet parking for 24 hours is $38 - something we did not know before we booked. There is a garage across the street with 24 hour parking for $34. Not much savings, and you can't take the car in and out from the garage. The location of this hotel is tough to comment on - it is in the theater district. Not a bad area but also not too much going on. It is walking distance to Copley Square/Newbury/Boylston area, and also to the Commons and Quincy Market. I have been to Boston many times and knew my way around but if you got a map of the city it was pretty self-explanatory how to get to the sites. The closest T train is about 2 blocks away. Staff was courteous and helpful at the front desk, and let us check at almost 4 hours early which we really appreciated. The room had a king bed, TV, desk, hairdryer, wi-fi and a mini-fridge. I really don't need anything more than that. It was clean, modern and smelled fine. Beds were comfy. My only complaint is the noise. The walls are very thin and we could hear everything the maids said in the hallway, even with our TV on. Also, as mentioned by others, there is a nightclub on the bottom floor. We were on the 7th floor and could hear the bass. It didn't bother us as we had just been out on the town but I can see it irking others. Overall, for what I paid for this room, I would absolutely stay there again. But I would not stay for full price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to stay if seeing a show”
Reviews.Author: MAbeach64
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband and daughter on Sunday night of Labor Day weekend because we were seeing "Wicked" at the Opera house. The hotel is right in the middle of the theatre district so it was an easy walk to the restuarant and then over to the theatre and back. The room was fine - a little small but we were there so briefly that it didin't matter. Things did seem a little shabby around the edges - it could do with some updating. We were on the 9th floor and did get some street noise and could "feel" the bass from the nightclub downstairs but it didn't keep us awake. Overall it was an acceptable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed.”
Reviews.Author: G7ORM
Reviews.Content: Hotel felt old and in need of some renovation. Whilst foyer was clean and tidy enough, landings and room felt very dated. Free-standing wardrobes meant the room felt very small. I didn't realise that Marriott had lower-end Hotels ("Courtyard"). Wouldn't have booked here if I had known.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: thunderstreak14
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine - though the rooms were very small, we did have a great view of the city from our 8th floor window. The only problem we encountered was the housekeeping staff were incredibly noisy - shouting in the corridors from 7am or earlier - not what you want on holiday! The rooms also did not have wifi - only available in the foyer or business center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: Hannah1812
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 3 adults - parents plus 20 year-old daughter (who got a double bed all to herself). We stayed for a total of 5 nights split into two separate occasions, and had two different rooms - one was significantly bigger than the other but both were perfectly clean and adequate - and quite nicely decorated. The location is good but not glamorous - very close to Boston Common in the Theater District, and there is a subway stop just over the road. The staff were friendly, and we made use of the free internet and coffee available. We didn't try the breakfast - there are plenty of places nearby which were more to our taste. If you want to be out and about around Boston as we did, this hotel is perfectly fine. It isn't a high-class place to lounge around all day, but it was more than adequate for us.

Reviews.Title: “On the low end of decent for Courtyards. Obnoxious club adjacent to lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Brenndog
Reviews.Content: The building is attractive from the outside, and in pretty decent shape on the inside. The room was pretty standard CY fare, although a bit dated, particularly when compared to the renovated CYs that are popping up around the country. My main complaint was the obnoxious dance club which is adjacent to the lobby which is overflowing with early twenty-somethings and has overwhelming bass reverberating everywhere. Oh, and don't fall for the $35 valet parking, there's much cheaper garage or street parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Courtyard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: quoo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few Courtyard Marriotts and this is definitely the nicest I've stayed at. While it doesn't offer the amenities of a regular Marriott or Hilton, it is very nice. The rooms are well furnished, and I stayed in a very nice room on the 15th floor. The room was a good size, and well furnished and quite comfortable. (Although in this I may have been lucky, my mother in law and sister in law also stayed in the hotel and they told us that our room was much larger than theirs). We had a few problems while staying at the hotel, at one point our toilet stopped up (never a nice thing to have happen) but the front desk sent someone up immediately to fix it, and when my hair dryer wasn't working, they also immediately sent another up, so I could blow dry my hair in time for the wedding we were attending. All of the staff were very friendly and nice - service was excellent. The only problem I'd say we had was that the staff at breakfast were a bit slow. There's also a nightclub on the ground floor, so you'll want to avoid the lower levels of this hotel on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Cozy-in a great area”
Reviews.Author: duddes02
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for a weekend trip to Boston. The room was pretty small-there wasn't alot of room to walk around-but it was perfectly adequate. The hotel was in the perfect location-close walk to everything (including the subway). Free coffee in the lobby :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and good room quality.”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Engineer_Germany
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly in this, not so spacious, hotel. The room I was given was clean and reasonable size, though a little small for the normal USA standards I had seen before. There were road works happening just outside the hotel at the time I stayed there but no noise disturbed my sleep at night. The services were good. The transport to the airport was arranged for me. Breakfast was ok, though could have been a little better I think. The downtown is in walking distance away so the shops are closeby.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms and noisy”
Reviews.Author: billyclyde
Reviews.Content: We spent a three-day weekend at this Courtyard in June 2010. As others have noted, the rooms are very small. Our room was probably the smallest room I have ever stayed at in the US. The bathroom was also very small. There is a nice, but small, flat-panel TV, but since it can't be swiveled, it can only be viewed from half the room. Our room was on the backside of the hotel, so we didn't get any of the street noise and nightclub noise that others have complained about, but the walls are extremely thin. Every morning, the alarm in the room next door woke up my wife, and at night, we could hear the entire conversation from the room next door, which kept us up much later than we wanted. This was the one of the noisiest rooms I have ever stayed in. Although we were on an upper level, the view was not very nice. The location is mixed -- on one hand, it is close to the theater district and Boston Commons, but on the other, it is not a nice part of town. There is a small, but nice fitness center on the 6th floor. Internet is free, but on two of the three nights we were there it got bogged down to the point that I gave up and did something else. There is a small breakfast restaurant in the lobby. We tried to eat there one morning, but the staff was overwhelmed. They had run out of some of the food in the buffet, and other food that was supposed to be hot was stone cold. Service was poor and slow. For the rest of our trip, we went somewhere else to eat. No newspapers were delivered to our room, and we didn't get a copy of our bill under our door on checkout day. Small things, but just other examples of the lack of service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in two different rooms... world of difference”
Reviews.Author: nickiwms
Reviews.Content: got this hotel through "name your own price" on priceline (like i do with all my hotels) and got it for two different weekends during a new england states road trip. the first night we stayed in a little room with two double beds. nothing was wrong with the room but it was small and nothing fancy. with my husband and i and our 4 year old, there wasn't much room for anything. the second stay was for two nights and we got an end room that was twice as big as the other.. it was a longer room and felt twice as big. had four great windows overlooking boston. the bathroom was also bigger and being on the end of the floor really cut out any possible noise issues (however, there wasn't any issues to begin with). we didn't have much interaction with the staff so i can't say much for that however the bell hops were very nice. the hotel is very proximal to everything and right in the theater district. we walked to everything including the freedom trail, duck boat tour and then took the train to museums and fenway. as i think i ended up paying half the price of rack rate, i was very pleased (got it for $65/night).

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean but small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sgthomson
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel in the Theatre District well located for convention centres, bars and restaurants. Noise from the night life and the adjacent Tufts Medical Centre can be a problem and I would suggest that you request a room on a high floor facing away from the road. The building is old and therefore the rooms are small. Very small! They are clean and well equipped and have complementary internet. They are adequate for a night or two but if you suffer from claustrophobia then perhaps consider other options. The breakfast is good value and a reasonable choice for the $12 charge. Coffee is available 24/7 in reception. If you are traveling alone, on a budget and are a heavy sleeper then The Courtyard is a good choice. There are however many other options in Boston worth consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great value stay”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: My second stay here and I'm glad I did. It's in the theater district and one street from the Orange line making it easy to get to and fro. I've stayed here once before and enjoyed it. This time stayed here for three nights - I was offered a suite at no extra charge and the accommodations were pleasant.Not huge but what you'd expect from a big city hotel room. The front desk was very helpful in providing weekly events and restaurant recommendations in Chinatown (an easy walk from the hotel). Great value if working downtown and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel, cool location....Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: VarsityStriker
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the front desk agent basically let us choose our own room, even thought we were paying a discounted rate. We felt like the most impt. guests at the hotel. It was a huge spaciour room, which I know is rare for an older hotel. We were in town to attend the Extreme Beer Fest at the Boston Center for the Arts, so this hotel was a quick and easy walk straight down Tremont. We couldn't have asked for more from this great hotel. Top-notch!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great location if you don't mind street noise”
Reviews.Author: crimson325
Reviews.Content: Got a room here for $65 on Priceline -great deal for Valentine's Day! Tiny room and lots of street noise at night (even when I requested a quiet room and we were put on the 11th floor). No real complaints though since the price was so good. I would not pay more than this for the small room we had though - our King room was honestly the smallest room I've ever stayed in outside of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: snowshoe_bunnie
Reviews.Content: The hotel's in an old building and was undergoing some exterior renovations when I was there. Nonetheless the lobby was elegant and pretty. Room was cramped and the room and its furnishings were slightly dated although I'm not sure if this was in line with the theme of the hotel.There was also no luggage rack in the room, and not that that was much room for that, but I called housekeeping and they brought one up for me. I also thought the lighting in the room was pretty yellow, which would have been fine if it wasn't a bit on the dim side. Where cleanliness is concerned the room was a bit dusty but alright on the whole. I like that this hotel is located at a very convenient part of Boston, with Chinatown, Downtown Crossing, the Public Gardens and Back Bay all within close walking distance. There is also a jazz bar on the ground floor, a plus. Checking in and out was fuss free. However since the hotel in located on a busy street it was difficult to get taxis to stop. The hotel staff were not around to help get cabs (at this hotel they don't call for cabs but rather hail them from the road) but one of the bellhops was very apologetic when he did come along to help. Perhaps they were understaffed at that point. The best selling point of this hotel would be its location but hopefully they do better on the quality of rooms bit.

Reviews.Title: “Bit Pricey for Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Micklefielder
Reviews.Content: A magnificent old building - originally called The Bradford I believe - The Courtyard is ideally placed in the centre of Boston with the public gardens and Boston Common only a short walk away, making it a perfect location for history buffs. It is also in the heart of the Theatre District close to Chinatown. Unfortunately, however, like most older buildings, space is a problem here too and ours was one of the smaller hotel rooms that you can expect to find anywhere. That said, it was perfectly adequate for our needs and the kingsized bed was very comfortable indeed. I was also quite impressed with the bathroom facilities and the view from our room of the Back Bay area was also quite impressive. Wasn't too impressed with what passed as the hotel restaurant, though, and the breakfasts weren't up to much either. On one occasion, I got charged onto my room account even after paying cash with gratuity for a breakfast. During our seven night stay, we were disturbed twice during the night by fire alarm actuations, which I am led to believe were caused by break-glass points being activated by late night revellers in one of the adjoining nightclubs. When this did happen, evacuation of the building was a bit too slow for my liking, especially as the fire department was already in attendence by the time that we hit the ground floor. Furthermore, on the morning that we were due to check-out, I received a bill for car parking and valetting, which I did find rather odd considering the fact that I didn't have a car. However, in spite of these small inconveniences, we did enjoy our stay. The hotel Manager was very helpful and so was the reception staff. And the small touches were nice too. Like when we were given complimentary toothbrushes, toothpaste and deodorants after my wife's suitcase had been left at the airport in New Jersey. All in all, a fair to middling hotel with a very grand interior, but a bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: mascot24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a while back but i definately enjoyed my stay. I have read a lot a reviews about people having small rooms but we must of been lucky as ours was very roomy. There were 2 queen beds which were so comfortable, large tv, and a great power shower. We never really had to converse with the staff much other than when we wanted something from our safety deposit box. I wasnt keen on the box being at reception, it would of been better in the room. We always found it to be very quiet even although their was a nightclub down stairs, although it may be dependent on where the rooms are! Breakfast wasnt included but we did pay for breakfast in the hotel one morning and i thought it was a bit expensive for what you got. I would say that was probably my only critisism. Other than at night we often had to walk a certain way home so we didnt pass the gangs that hung around the nearby 7/11. However, this is not the hotels fault and we never had any problems we just often felt uncomfortable when passing them! Am sure they were harmless!! We got a very good deal on this hotel and i would definately go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the vintage lobby; too bad we couldn't STAY in the vintage lobby.”
Reviews.Author: QuietKidYaBotherMe
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this hotel isn't horrible; it's just several notches below what I've come to expect from a Courtyard. Part of the problem stems from the fact that this is a "historic" hotel (1925, I believe) that has been repurposed as a Courtyard. I understand that it's difficult to take an old building and effectively bring it up to modern standards. It can be done, of course, but it requires both money and ingenuity. There was too little of both invested here. The lobby is magnificent and promises an elegance the rest of the building doesn't deliver. The elevators are small and slow, and at least one of the cars made ominous noises every time we used it. The room was TINY. My traveling companion and I were constantly getting in each other's way as we attempted to navigate in the cramped quarters. There was no real dresser; just an armoire that played fast and loose with the laws of physics by being freakishly large on the outside and woefully small on the inside. There WAS a small, two drawer unit that doubled as a nightstand. The room did have a flat-screen TV (which was fortunate because there was NO place to put an old standard set ) that someone had scrawled "No Good" on the back of with a sharpie. I concurred with this evaluation. The maid service was questionable at best. We had to ask the front desk to send up shampoo and conditioner bottles, as Housekeeping evidently didn't view the presence of empty bottles in the trash can as a sign that we might NEED MORE. Towel replacement was equally spotty. I'm guessing that the linens buyer for this establishment thinks washcloths are terribly overrated, as we had to resort to using hand towels after the first morning. At least work environment in the room was up to Courtyard standards. Oh, wait . . . no it WASN'T. Small, cramped desk wedged in next to the gigantic armoire. It was actually one of those "nesting" desks that had a second work surface that could be pulled out to make more space. If it actually could have been pulled out. Which it COULDN'T, because it was too close to the bed. There was a LAN cable in case your ancient laptop isn't wireless, but the plug was broken. We didn't bother trying the hotel's free wireless -- Sprint MiFi: Don't leave home without it. At least two of the power outlets in the room didn't work. I'd like to say that the wonderful breakfast every morning made up for all this, but of course it didn't. We asked a simple question the first morning: Can you make an egg-white omelette? The answer was "yes." This was a lie. It's quite the culinary achievement to create something that is simultaneously undercooked and burned, but our cook did so with aplomb. Twice. Thrice, actually, as we saw other patrons grimacing their way through similar meals. Fortunately, there is a Starbuck's just around the corner that served breakfast. The bright spot -- and there WAS one -- is that the Desk staff and the Bell Service were first rate. They were helpful, courteous, and prompt. The location was also great -- convenient to the convention center, and within easy walking distance of a number of superb restaurants. But I wouldn't do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: jburrows500
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was greeted at the front door by the valet and bell staff. Checked in by Kevin and another woman, both very friendly and quick with a few restaurant recommendations. I went down to the front desk Sunday morning and requested a late check out as the two feet of snow hampered our travel plans a little bit. Kevin, who apparently was snowed in and was again on duty this morning couldn't have been any more accommodating. The only criticism I would have would be a stain on the comforter. Aside from that, I would give it a solid B+. Service was an A+. The place is great! Relaxed atmosphere but very efficient and accommodating. Would not hesitate to stay here again. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in the theater district”
Reviews.Author: crasher1339
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, right off the pike. Service was great, quick checkin and valet service. Room was perfect, the only reason not 5/5 there was the walls were kind of thin - we could hear alot of noise from next room over, in particular a baby who cried on and off all night. Guess you can't blame the hotel for that. Staff in the restaurant/bar in the lobby were very friendly. Got a great rate for weekend as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us - sometimes long walks.”
Reviews.Author: azindy
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked for us...but it was often a long walk to the many places that we wanted to go. We did take the train and the stop was pretty close especially when we went to cambridge. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms were typical Marriott rooms. Liked having internet downstairs in the lobby for quick map look ups! We had breakfast at the little cafe downstairs and wasn't all that impressed....a little expensive for what you get. We did not do the buffett. The dunkin donuts was not too far and we did do that one morning for a reasonable priced coffee and quick donut. I would probably want to stay closer down by the harbour if we went back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls you could hear TV in the next room”
Reviews.Author: SuperFussyTraveler
Reviews.Content: At the time I wrote this review, it was 1:50am. The guest in the next room has been watching tv all evening at high volume until this hour (still going). Finally I contacted the hotel staff and someone came knock on their door to tell them to turn down the volume. The volume was down a bit but I could still hear it. I contacted the staff again, and was told they would tell the guest to shut it off. The tv is still on. Because the tv is mounted on the wall between us, I could still hear the bass noise. If you are usually not bothered by noise, this hotel would be a very good choice for visiting Boston on a budget. I got the room at a very low rate through priceline. Room is small as others have noted. The plus side is there is free wired internet in the room and wifi in the lobby. The location cannot be better. Right in the middle of theater district and two blocks to Boston Commons. A T station is also nearby.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: salbanese
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Marriotts and have had great experiences. This hotel was not your typical Marriott. The first room we were assigned was so small we could bareley move in it. The front desk person was very accommodating and moved us to a bigger room. Unfortunately, the outside noise was so loud that we could not sleep and left at 3pm to drive home. I think the noise was coming from a heating system or vent. Also, our room was right next to the elevator which we seemed to be going non stop.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but expected more from a Courtyard Property”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveler46
Reviews.Content: We booked at the last minute and were looking for something convenient to the event we were attending. The hotel is not that bad. I would say it is a pretty standard hotel, but it could use some updating. For Boston's theatre district or for Boston Common, you can not beat the location. Rooms were pretty small, but that was somewhat expected for a smaller hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: lojo34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott hotel over Labor Day weekend. Our trip was planned at the last minute, so we opted for this property because we were able to get a very good rate here through the Marriott website. There were definitely pros and cons to this property. PROS: The hotel is very convenient to the subway (one street over), which we loved; the staff is very friendly and helpful; the room was clean; there are restaurants close by. CONS: I didnâ€™t really like the neighborhood (the theatre district) that much â€“ especially compared to other areas weâ€™ve stayed in Boston; there is an incredibly LOUD nightclub either next door or in the lobby and even on the eleventh floor we could still hear the bass booming when we were in the bathroom (it didnâ€™t wake us up, but we did have to shut the bathroom door to go to sleep at night); the rooms are teeny, tiny. If I returned to Boston, this hotel probably wouldnâ€™t be my first choice, but I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay here again (on a high floor!) if it was the only reasonably priced property available.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: spudly187
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for my 30th birthday. The location is ok as Boston is very small to get around. Only a short walk to all the major attractions. The room had everything we needed for a few days with the most comfortable beds I have ever experienced from a hotel (wanted to bring it home with me!!) the bathroom was just right with a decent shower. (Also a great view of the city as we were on the 10th floor!) There was free coffee and a small shop in case you needed anything like crisps, hot meals, cereal, soft drinks and alcoholic drinks. The only thing I didn't like was the safety deposit boxes were behind the reception desk which was abit of a pain if we needed something out. Overall I really enjoyed my stay here and would definatley recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a couple of days in Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Reminded me of a European hotel, in a bad way.”
Reviews.Author: Johnathon
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard reminded me a lot of many budget European hotels in that the rooms are small (like really small), the decor is outdated, and the public spaces are 10 to 15 years past the time in which they really should have been refurbished. That said, if you are in Boston to see the theater, the location can't be beat. Or if you don't want to pay another $50 to stay at the superior Marriott Long Wharf or Custom House properties, this place is fine. But it's certainly no better than "fine."

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: TartanD
Reviews.Content: As a company recommended hotel I stayed one night at the Courtyard Tremont and I had concerns after reading previous reviews. The location - this was the first time I did not feel comfortable in an area and thankfully I spent time in the Back Bay area the following week which gave me a far better impression of Boston. Check in at the hotel was ok - lobby area was very nice although the lifts at times were very slow - it was better to take the stairs. The bedrooms were very small and my bathroom was tiny - the door only just opened before hitting the bathroom sink. I was on the 8th floor but still was awakened at 2am with music, people leaving the club and car horns blasting. I thought breakfast was very poor and as someone who is lactose intollerant found the choice limited as the hotel had no soya milk - coffee was very poor too. If I had to go back to Boston I certainly would certainly choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: TC99
Reviews.Content: This is the3rd week I've stayed at the Marriott. If you have a room on the 15th floor, you will have a regularly sized room. Otherwise, they are small. On Sunday nights the bar next door has a transvestite night, so don't be surprised! The staff is very friendly and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: TigEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights for an enjoyable trip to Boston. What this hotel lacks in location (a fifteen minute walk to main attractions in a relatively small city), it makes up for in comfort. The room was small but modern, tasteful and very comfortable. (The most comfortable beds in the world - we didn't want to leave and see the city - seriously!) The bathroom was large with a fantastic power shower. Breakfast (not included for us) was average, but served by attentive staff. The foyer was stunning and the bar had live jazz in the evenings. The original Cheers bar is a ten minute walk away. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place for family with young children or those on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: geekydweeb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 2 little girls in October 2009. Let me say wouldn't recommend staying here unless you are seeing a show in the theater district. The location was nice, but it is right in the middle of downtown and traffic can be difficult. Parking costs $36 per night and you have to tip the valet (and you must use the valet, no self parking option). So if you come and go alot it gets expensive quickly. The hotel also requires if you use a cart it must be done by a bellhop. Another tip. Don't get me wrong they deserve a tip, but I like to do things myself and would at least like the option. We stayed on the 10th floor and didn't hear any of the nightclub music others have complained about. But our bed was extremely small even for a double and it was quite uncomfortable. They layered many "pillowtop" coverings on that really didn't work right. They bunched up and my wife and I were never comfortable. Our room only had a stand-up shower, no tub. Which if you have small kids you will want a tub. Also note there is no pool at this hotel. If I stayed again in Boston I would save alot of money and book out further where parking is free and there is a pool. My parents also stayed in a different room and there room had a king size bed and the room was extremely tiny. I would have been very upset had I gotten a room that small. They said they were sold out and didn't have any other rooms. Overall I would recommend staying somewhere else. It wasn't a terrible experience, just lessons learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WATERMELLON212
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The rooms were nice, staff was great. What a great location, not far from train.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Freeway12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel just this past weekend. It was really a wonderful place and highly recommended. We did ask for a room on a high floor before we went and they had one all ready for us. It was on the 15th floor and was a very nice size. The bathroom was large also. It had a huge window with shutters. The weather was perfect and we were able to open the window a bit and let some fresh air in. Even though we were on the 15th floor , we still heard noises from the people outside on the streets below but it didn't bother us. And if we would have closed the window, we probably would not have heard anything. We had a view of some tall buildings and also it looked like some apts with rooftop terraces. Very nice! The staff was excellent and did anything for you. We highly recommend the breakfast buffet at the restaurant on the premise. Asked for extra towels and tissues and got them. Nothing was a problem. We will stay here again when we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Retofitted Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sirdar54
Reviews.Content: This is a 1920's era hotel that was remodelled but not expanded. The room we were in on the 10th Floor was quite small and as other posters noted the flat screen TV is positioned toward one end of the room which can make viewing awkward. Likewise, the comments regarding noise from the 1st floor bars is accurate. We request an upper floor and a room near the rear of the hotel which solved this problem. The room has a desk with internet access but is too small foe a separate chair and lamp which is pretty much standard in other hotels. We paid over $200 per night9when taxes are included) which was too much for this accomdation. If you can get it for about half through Priceline or other discount vehicle it's probably OK since the location in the therter district is not a bad one. Otherwise look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: FaysterS
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard in Boston. We were slightly worried beforehand based on some of the reviews we had read but we had a great stay. As we read on some reviews about the nightclub noise we requested a room on a higher floor both through our travel agent and upon arrival. We were on the tenth floor and had no problems with noise. The location was extremely convenient - within walking distance of the Common and the Public Garden plus the Freedom Trail. We also walked to Fanueil Hall and further although this took a bit longer! Breakfast was great with lots on offer and friendly service. The staff on reception were always very couteous and helpful too. Beware - the Piano Bar by the main entrance is very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSPET
Reviews.Content: The lobby flatters to decieve at the Marriott on Tremont. It is beutiful. The rooms don't quite live up to the same standard but it is satisfactory. I stayed here about 3 years ago. The hotel has had a refit since then but it seems like half a job was done. For example the desks, wardrobes and TVs have all been replaced and look very nice, but the fixtures and fittings, doors, door stops, carpets etc don't seem to have been replaced. The result is a half finished job. It is satisfactory and in a decent location but it's nothing special. The fitness centre is adequate for a work out but it is small. more than 3 people in there and you might struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: glandsb500
Reviews.Content: I purchased our stay using Priceline and this was the hotel we got. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel - it was obviously a very gracious establishment once upon a time, but it is now starting to show its age. It is right in the middle of the Boston theater district, so great for location as there is also a T station nearby. Beware, there is NO reasonable parking in Boston and especially around this hotel. We were charged $36 to park for 8 hours at a parking garage across the street. The hotel lobby is very grand, but the rooms are tiny by comparison to similar hotels in this grade category. There is free internet available. The bathroom only has a shower which was not a problem for us as we prefer a shower - that was a plus. One odd thing in the room was that there was a great new flat panel TV but it was offset so much that one had difficulty seeing it from the right hand side of the bed, there was no way that one could adjust it for a better viewing angle - not serious as we did not come to Boston to watch TV! We had our breakfast in the hotel restaurant as it was very good and was excellent value for money. If you are coming to Boston without a car then you cannot get a better location than this - if you have a car then forgetaboutit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, on Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: Edmonchukz
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline for about 85$ per night. Small rooms, but great location right near the train station which takes you everywhere you want to go in the City. There is a great piano bar worth checking out on a saturday night. Thanks Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Great Location - Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DMC16
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Courtyard Boston Downtown early July 2009. We found the hotel offered all the amenities that we needed for our trip - free internet access in the lobby, 24hr shop (very small selection - just necessities), complimentary Fitness Centre, etc. The room we stayed in was nice. We found it spacious, clean, comfortable and for the price we paid (around Â£75 per night) good value. If we were to visit Boston in the future, I would have no objections to staying there again (at a similar price). It is, as it was advertised to us, a 3*+. The room featured a nice size bed, flat screen TV, OK bathroom and decent decor. Don't get me wrong, it is no 5* hotel - but that is not what we booked. The hotel is situated in a decent location - Theatre District (not the classiest part of town) however, it is only a 5 minute walk to Boston common and 10 minutes to the main centre (if less). Boston is a great city to visit, and if you are planning on getting out and about all day and using the hotel as a base / decent place to rest your head...I strongly recommended this hotel. If you are looking for a 5* pamper weekend - you might want to book somewhere else. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in theater district”
Reviews.Author: oktravelguy
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard by Marriott on Tremont St. is a historic hotel in an excellent location for business travelers like myself. Service and location were excellent! There were a few disadvantages, however, not enough to keep me from returning. Overall, a great hotel! My first impression was the service on the phone was top notch. They answered the phone relatively fast, offered personalized service and estimated the cab fares within a dollar for several destinations across town. The $12 breakfast buffet was nice and included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, fruit, cereal, oatmeal and a few other items. The bars inside were attractive, dark and quiet. Good places to meet up for a night cap before heading up to the room. The second impression made was the location. After I was quickly checked in, I was shown a map of the surrounding attractions and offered a list of nearby restaurants and directions. The map showed the hotel to be in the theater district and within walking distance of Chinatown and the Arts district. Theaters are right next door and across the street with big name attractions. Chinatown is a block away with it's usual exotic attractions. The Arts district is a good 5 minute walk away, which is just past the park. The cab ride from the airport was about $32 ($7 of that is the tax charged for going through the tunnel), the cab ride to the Boston Convention Center was about $8. Cab rides can be a little shady with their fees and alternate routes. Be sure to discuss rates and routes with the driver first so he knows not to cheat you. I considered taking the subway, but wasn't able to risk running late to my meetings. There were a few issues that kept this hotel from being perfect, but not even close to being enough to keep me from returning. Scaffolding was set up in front of the facade of the hotel for some type of remodeling, but it wasn't in the way of walking along the sidewalk. I did have difficulty receiving a signal in some parts of the lobby, but that may be an issue with my carrier. This hotel does not have a pool, but there is a YMCA nearby. Although there is a 24 hr exercise room, it is limited to treadmills and the like. There were no free weights and the room was not very large. As with most historic hotels, this room was not considered large, however, it contained a queen size bed, two bedside tables, a desk and flat screen tv. The tv was mounted on the wall with a magazine rack below only sticking out about two inches from the wall. For some reason, my tv did not show a picture. I only turned it on for background noise while ironing my shirt, so it didn't disappoint me. Overall, I felt that this hotel was an excellent choice for someone who intending on attending the theater, business trip or vacationing in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location for business travel but beware the small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: IrishGal21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the week for several nights while visiting Tufts Dental School on a business trip. The location was very convenient to multiple attractions: Boston Common, T stations, Theater District, New England Medical Center, New England School of Law, Tufts Medical/Dental/Public Health, Citi Performning Arts Center, Wang Theater, etc. Security was good in that doormen man the entrance and a room key is required for the elevator. The room itself, while clean and beautifully, was VERY small. This wasn't a problem for me as a solo traveller and someone who's stayed in comparable European boutique hotels. However, as mentioned in previous reviews, the room would prove "cozy" for couples and way too small for families. The armoire partially blocked the window and the desk and bed dominated the room. The bathroom is a half-bath with only a shower. My room had a connecting (albeit locked) entrance to the room next door, and the walls were thin enough that the neighbors could have been in my room. That said, being on the 8th floor (of 15) kept me far enough away from street noise to get a decent night's sleep. Check-in was routine. The staff was polite but not overly friendly. The doormen were courteous and greeted me daily. Be aware that there is NO shuttle to Logan airport but several T lines are within walking distance and cabs drive by regularly. Were I to visit this area of Boston again, I would consider this hotel but wouldn't go out of my way to stay here. It seems odd that this hotel is considered a Courtyard Marriott given the boutique rooms and the location. There's also a Doubletree nearby, and the W Boston a half-block away should be open by November 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, so so for tourists”
Reviews.Author: nyuszi
Reviews.Content: If you are in town for business in the downtown/financial district and need a more budget-conscious option, this is a great choice. It's just outside of downtown, in the theater district and a short walk to the red, green or orange lines of the MBTA as well as a quick walk to most any location downtown. The rooms have gorgeous furniture, a nice large desk and free internet. The fitness room is decent and you can run in the Commons/Public Garden nearby. The front desk was also very accommodating, getting me into my room when I arrived from a red eye, 4 hours ahead of check-in. For tourists, there's certainly a lot to recommend it - again, close to the T and the theaters, as well as a short walk to Newbury St/Copley Sq. And because of the theater crowd, plenty of generic, mid-priced (PF Changs, Rock Bottom) food options just out the door. However, there are a few reasons to stay elsewhere if you are primarily in town for leisure. First, the rooms are SMALL. Totally adequate for a single, a bit cozy for a couple, can't imagine cramming any kids in there. Second, it's LOUD. On Thu, Friday and Saturday a large crowd of folks will be at Caprice/The Roxy on the lower level of the hotel. The people waiting outside in line are noisy, and I could hear the DJ as if he were in the room next door (I was on the 7th floor). But, overall, I had a very positive stay. I'd heartily recommend it for business and I'd still recommend it for tourists, just with those caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, nice location, beware the weekends”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Callahan
Reviews.Content: The Boston Marriott Tremont was a comfortable hotel. Not a large room, but perfectly fine and about what I'd expect when staying in a big city. Location is in the middle of the theater district and mere blocks from Chinatown and Boston Common. The city center and harbor is walkable but the subway is less than a block away. Exercise room was good - several treadmills and steppers, a semi-recumbent bike (bring headphones for TV hookups) and lots of free weights. Also has free wi-fi. My only issue with this hotel was that you needed a key to use the elevator and on Friday night I discovered why - on Friday night you need a key to get into the hotel, too. See, there's a nightclub on the first floor and clearly it's a traffic problem for them. Although I was on the 8th floor, I could hear the nightclub's thumping bass at midnight. I'm a heavy sleeper, but others might not be so lucky. Also, I noted huge lines at check-in when tour buses arrived. The lobby was literally filled for a full hour one afternoon. Overall, I do recommend this place, particularly for business or theater travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Bottom of the barrel. The reviews are accurate”
Reviews.Author: smushie
Reviews.Content: The location was great (2 blocks from Boston Common), the lobby was charming and the front desk staff were friendly at times but the positives end there. From check-in to check-out this was the worst Marriott experience I have ever had. I've stayed in hotels in nearly every major city in the US (NY, Boston, Chicago, and LA) and the rooms in this hotel were still postage stamp sized by comparison. You'd need to go to Europe (or a cruise ship) to find a comparably sized room and even then rarely have I encountered a room so small anywhere in the world. Some rooms don't even have closets and I couldn't figure out how to sit in the office chair (the only place to sit besides the bed) without blocking the exit to the room. The bathroom in particular was so small that it could only fit a stand-up shower and I literally needed to straddle the toilet in order to close the door. A quick look at the floor plan revealed a handful of corner rooms (and the 15th floor) that were somewhat larger but, unless you get lucky, brace yourself for banged knees on furniture. The "nightclub" issues that other reviewers mentioned are accurate as well. The block where the hotel is located is shared with several clubs blasting "booming" music with patrons attired in skirts so short they needed to hold them down in order to walk. Rather than a random event, seeing stumbling drunk girls dressed like prostitutes was a regular sight in front of the hotel. Beyond the noise issue, I also noticed an abundance of cheap liquor bottles (and broken glass) strewn about the area which I observed was the result of club patrons trying to "chug" down booze before entering the club and leaving what they couldn't finish for homeless people to collect when they weren't chatting with the bellmen or pan-handling in front of the hotel. As for the staff, there were some that were professional and others that were downright rude (e.g. a bellman that stood at the front desk scowling at me with his hand out waiting for a tip). My advice would be to find another place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very good standard of rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fairyhobbit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in July 2009. I would definately recommend this hotel to people visiting Boston. The hotel is in the theatre district and a short walk from the park and the main shops. The hotel offers excellent broadband service, free BRILLIANT coffee in the reception area and good washing facilities. The only downside is the price of valet parking. Overall we were very pleased with the location and would stay here without doubt when back in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ianwaldecker
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went with another couple to see a Red Sox game, and the other couple booked this hotel, which I was greatful for since it was one less thing I had to do. I've stayed at many Marriotts, so I'm comfortable with the chain. First of all we immediately found out that valet parking, which is really the only option, is $32+ per day, and a day is considered 3 or more hours. What a rip off. Upon entering the hotel, there is nice lobby with the hotel's eating area off to the right. We got checked in quickly and went up to our rooms. The rooms were next to each other, and were both standard rooms, however they were different. We had an armoire for a closet, and our friends had a bigger closet built as part of the room. We had a flat screen tv with very poor reception, and their tv didn't even work, ironically one of the friends we were with works for a cable company. They had a small refridgerator and we didn't. Plus, the rooms were small. If you've ever been on a cruise ship, these rooms might be a little bigger but not much, the bathrooms are a little bigger but not the bedrooms. While in the bathroom I was noticing that the grout between the tiles was much darker where people walked, and was very light behind the door. Overall the room seemed relatively clean. The shower was a stand-up stall, no bath tub, and was minimalistic, nothing fancy. Just make sure the curtain stays inside the stall, we almost flooded our bathroom because it flopped on the outside of the stall's base. Water pressure was ok, I've had worse, but it isn't strong. Upon returning from the game around 11:15pm we walked by a dance club directly next door to the hotel, which we didn't notice when arriving. The music was blaring and could be heard and felt very easily in the lobby of the hotel. Upon getting to our room on the 8th floor we could still hear the bass beats of the club music pretty easily. When booking a room here make sure to get as far away from the club as possible! Also, if you want a view ask for it, I opened our shades and was looking at other hotel rooms. I wouldn't rate this as a terrible experience, but I wouldn't stay at this location again. The price was decent for a Marriott in the middle of Boston, but there were too many shortcomings. There's also no pool; we wouldn't have had time to use it, but if we had had extra tiime, I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It's a typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: BrittlePeanut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of a two week tour for two nights and again for one night at the end. As I say, it's a typical Marriott - clean, with small rooms. The location was good - not great, but value for money. Great base for getting around, but you wouldn't want to hang about the room or the hotel for much time - not that there is anything wrong with it, but it's no more than a small room in a nice hotel. Some reviews say this hotel is in a dogey area - i disagree, it's just not bang in the centre, if it was it would cost twice as much, we felt perfectly comfortable in that district. It did the job for us - well priced and centrally located, with clean rooms - I would stay again if we were looking for a base to get about from. It's a bit tired in places - and avoid the piano bar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a historic building”
Reviews.Author: everhart76
Reviews.Content: As it is a historic building, the rooms were a bit small; but my wife and I enjoyed our two night stay here. We found the front desk to be friendly, our room to be clean, and the location was ideal. The hotel is in close proximity to Boston Commons, Fanueil Hall, Emerson College, and Newbury Street. From this hotel we were able to walk all over the city, including a long but do-able walk to Fenway Park. Following advice we picked up from this website, we requested a floor near the top of the building, so as to avoid the sound of the bars on the ground floor, and the front desk staff was most accommodating. The rooms were a bit small (which is to be expected for an historic building in the middle of a city) and the TV was fixed on the wall and unable to swivel. That being said, it was nice to have a flat screen TV, and the beds were those new, comfortable Marriott beds.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: HonestWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 12 night stay at this hotel. When we arrived we were given a very small room on the 11th floor, not enough room to swing a cat and very limited storage space. Happened to bump into the house keeper on this floor, after we had complained about room, who guided us into requesting a corner room, room 1129. This was much bigger and better and had a fridge. Although I gather the rooms on 15th floor are more luxurious. Was a little annoyed at having been given the smaller room in first place as we had a 12 night booking that had been made via Thompson about 9 months ago. Apart from this little hitch the hotel was fine, clean and served its purpose. On the whole the staff were friendly and helpful especially the house keeping staff. The area surrounding hotel is a little rundown but it is down town. So to be expected but it is a great location for getting out and about. Only had breakfast once during stay but that was more to do with trying to control food intake because of the size of meals served every where. The break fast was good with a good selection. Piano bar was naff and badly in need of an update. I would recommend this hotel but only on the basis of getting larger rooms or on the 15th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere! Great coffee!”
Reviews.Author: ReshmaBudhia
Reviews.Content: Having spent 4 days in tis hotel, I can say one thing for sure - they serve great coffee in their lobby, but the room coffee is bad!! Anyways the good thing about the hotel is that its a very old - almost 100 years old building and they have maintained the authenticity... however in a way that is also the bad thing as the rooms are small. The staff is very friendly and really go all out to help you, so that was a good experience. The location is perfect - so one can try out P.F Changs! In all I recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great experience (if you get the right room)”
Reviews.Author: ECL
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the 15th floor and found the entire floor to be very luxurious and well appointed. At this level, the rooms were large, quiet, and up to usual Marriott standards. The bellhop told us that the lower floors were much smaller but the 15th floor was essentially a former warehouse area so Marriott constructed new rooms by modern standards. We liked the location because it was still close to major tourist attractions like the Museum of Fine Art, Freedom Trail, Boston Commons, etc. and the theater district. Like any downtown hotel, you have to be careful and cautious at night if you are outside but in the hotel, we thought the security and protection was fine. There is no hotel shuttle, so its a $ 25 cab ride from Logan to the hotel but that's pretty consistent for all of Boston. The room high speed internet was AWFULLY slow for some reason and I found it much better to use the two computers on the 15th floor for printing and work.

Reviews.Title: “No More Courtyards for Us!”
Reviews.Author: RJKCAT
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 2:00, we were told there were no rooms ready. So we did some sightseeing, came back at 5:00 and were brought to a room next to the freight elevator. That would have been okay, except the room was an "end" room - so atypically shaped, we could barely get by the front of the beds without hitting the wall. And the outside noise was terrible. I called downstairs and told them the room was unacceptable. They told me twice the hotel was booked and there was nothing they could do. I said they'd have to find me another hotel. The manager got on the phone and found me another room. Although this room was right by the regular elevators and ice machine, we didn't complain. However, the bathroom was tiny (with a pocket door!), no place to put anything down, the outside noise was so bad we had to sleep with tissue ear plugs, and the A/C air poured down on us all night long so we woke up from our horrible sleep with sore throats. (We did move the A/C vents, to no avail.) For $200 a night, I'd expect a lot more from a Marriott. Maybe a JW Marriott, but we'll never stay at a Courtyard again. Especially this one.

Reviews.Title: “What a ripoff.”
Reviews.Author: chicorico
Reviews.Content: I want to give the good first. The maintenance man, maids and wait staff were helpful and very polite. That being said lets continue. The room was small I mean closet size for $229.00 a night. Nothing had been dusted. The TV was broken. The bathroom only had a small shower because the bathroom was tiny. the bathroom door was rusting and the hinges were real rusty. The walls were paper thin and we could hear the kids next door and in the hallway screaming. The elevators were very tempermental and sometime just didn't work. The free wireless was free because sometime (often) it would set itself free. When in the middle of printing my boarding passes it did just that. When we checked in the front desk people did not know their job. When we asked about the conference that had a large portion of the hotel booked they didn't know anything about it or how to find out about it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel with history in good location”
Reviews.Author: christel
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise after the horror of Long Wharf to come in a gracious building (it used to be an Elks lodge) and get a good welcome with a spacious room on the top floor. Fantastic views of the city. They have a key card for the front door and the lift so we felt secure and the doorman was always around. Managed to get some healthy choices at breakfast which is always a plus in USA and they have a little Food market selling salads, rolls and microwavable meals. Free wifi is a big plus too and tea and coffee in the foyer. Lots of restaurants all round as this is theatre district and Boston Common just up the street with 2 subway stops. Watch out for the pair of hawks resting on top of the baseball pitch floodlights on the Common!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE! DO NOT STAY HERE; NOT WORTH THE MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: SBJ486
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and his whole extended family stayed here for his sister's graduation from Emerson College. Apart from it being right across the street from Emerson, our experience was AWEFUL. The hotel is situated between TWO night clubs! Unless your room is a suite located on the 12th floor, you can hear the BOOM BOOM rhythm of music from about 10:30PM to EXACTLY 3 AM every night (better on Sunday). People are lined up outside the clubs smoking and blocking/confusing the entrance to the hotel. The music gets so loud, it literally sounds like it is in the next room. . . Speaking of your neighbor, you will be able to hear EVERYTHING because the walls are so thin! The rooms are EXTREMELY small, the beds are NOT COMFORTABLE (very hard), and the bathrooms even smaller! (Can barely fit two people in at once) The shower is only a shower stall. We were given a room that the AC was broken and it got very hot in our room- we later switched to a higher floor with AC that worked. It is also about a 20min cab ride anywhere you go- but can walk to China Town. Long story short- this hotel is NOT worth the price, and unless you plan on "Clubbing" for the entire night, you won't be able to get any sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Basic/Small”
Reviews.Author: joan4444
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Tremont for my daughters graduation. The hotel was clean... that is the positive. The rooms are very small and basic. There is a very small bathroom, with a small stall shower with a plan beige plastic shower curtain. The price was a little over $200.00 per night. I think I could have found a nicer hotel for that price. Possibly one which included parking, that was $60.00 extra for the two nights. I could have put that money toward a better hotel and had free parking. Some of the hotels do offer parking. Street parking is NOT an option in Boston. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine - I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews I wonder if we stayed at the same hotel. I stayed one night in late April at the outstanding rate of $109 + tax - which for Boston is superb. Its was just the standard rate off the Marriott website. The hotel is in an excellent location and I was surprised to see one reviewer declare the area as 'unsafe'. I really have to disagree. The hotel itself is obviously an older building and that, by definition, limits some stuff. I got a huge corner room on one of the upper floors (presumably because I am a Marriott Silver Member) which was excellent. The internet (free wired) worked perfectly and, certainly for me, was not dial-up speed but was fine. The bathroom and other facilities were all of a Courtyard standard. There is a small gym with reasonable kit all of which was working when I was there. Despite the fact that there are breakfast outlets a couple of hundred yards down the road I eat in the hotel as I wasn't sure if I'd get any lunch. I had an omelet and juice, coffee, etc and it was fine as well. Slightly pricey at $15 (incl taxes) but its not like the price isn't advertised. Staff were fine. The only thing I would comment upon is that the elevators were looking somewhat old and jaded. So, in summary, there was nothing which would make me recommend this hotel unreservedly. On the other hand there was nothing which would make me not recommend the hotel. A solid 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer places to stay”
Reviews.Author: happyfriday
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tremont about 4-5 years ago when it was being renovated. I decided to try the hotel again for a short trip over the Easter weekend. The hotel looked better and the room was much more confortable. The hotel was also very clean. However, based on my experience I wouldn't recommend staying in the Tremont. After being out for dinner I came back to the hotel at abour 10:00. There was really loud dance music coming into the room. I gave it half an hour and then called reception to complain - someone came up ten minutes later and said they there was a function going on in the rooms below but that it would be over by 11:00. I thought that this was fair enough and looked forward to getting some peace and quiet at 11:00. At 11:05 the music stopped - only to be replaced by a live grunge band. Things in the room started vibrating and I could hear every word and bang on the drumb. I called reception and spoke to an extremely rude person who told me that the hotel had a long established night club and that I should have been aware that it would be noisy. I knew that there was a nightclub on the ground floor - I was on the 6th floor - and that the noise couldn't be coming from here. He denies that there was a function on the fifth floor which I knew was a lie. The noise continued so I decided to go down to the fifth floor to see what on earth was going on. There was some big party which was going on until 2:00. I went down to reception and was now pretty tired. The reception staff were awful. They got angry that I had gone onto the fith floor to find out what was going on. They told me that the people had paid to have a function there and that I should be prepared to put up with the noise. They were completely disinterested, rude and clearly didn't care about customer service. I really wouldn't stay at the this hotel again. It would be fine for student groups or people who don't mind their rooms vibrating with every drumb and cymbal beat!

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe and Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Retiredonvacation
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a really bad area, unsafe to walk at night. Three piles of puke within a block this morning???? Construction next door. No place nearby for breakfast or to buy wine. room was tiny, free internet ran at dialup speeds. Every night they shut off the ac, so the room was uncomfortably warm every morning. Staff seemed disinterested. This place is a pit and Marriott is ruining its brand image because this property is way below standard.

Reviews.Title: “O.K Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PompeyGav1
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad, nothing great. Helpful Staff. Area was nothing special, but everything within a 5-10 minute walk. Rooms could do with a lick of paint !

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: peterc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 days here along with our daughter and her husband. We had a twin double room and our daughter had a King room. The King room was very small - the smallest room I have ever seen in a Marriott, Courtyard, Hilton or Holiday Inn - and that includes stays in New York and Europe, where rooms are notoriously small! It also had no bath, just a shower. The twin room we had was bigger with enough room for a city centre hotel as well as having a bath. The problem we had with our twin room was with the heating - and with Boston's weather even in March that is not what you want! The heating had an old fashioned controller which was clearly not thermostatic, and a 2 speed fan. At high speed the noise it made was unbearably loud, and after a while the fan started making squeaking and grinding sounds - so no sleep with that! And on slow speed it did not provide enough heat and the room got colder and colder. And unlike other Marriotts there were no additional blankets or other bedding in the room. So we had to get up during the night to switch the fan onto high speed then low speed a couple of times - not a very restful night! This seemed to be a problem only with our room and I suspect that the heating was simply not up to its increased size and corner location with 3 windows. Another problem was that we all agreed that the beds were not very comfortable - a complaint I have never had to make before with any Courtyard or Marriot. In fact my daughter normally chooses Marriott because of the great beds. And finally they were very mean with the toiletries and accessories - no safe, shower cap, or bath salts. for example The good bit is that the hotel is well located in a nice city. It is in the middle of the theatre district and Chinatown and Boston common are close, as are lots of restaurants - we especially liked Rock Bottom - the food and the beer they brew on the premises were both good.

Reviews.Title: “very thin walls ....”
Reviews.Author: late4adate
Reviews.Content: Hello, my brother and i stayed here for a night due to a college event. First of all, the hotel is in a good location, you can walk to most places, train station is not far, and chinatown is 2 minutes away. But as far as the hotel, its not very clean looking or well kept. No room service for anything, the only good thing is the breakfast buffet, that was pretty good. Most of all, security came up to our room around midnight, complaining of noise. Mind you, we had the tv on low and were talking to each other, not screaming or partying. They aplogized later and said the walls were "paper thin". I guess you can't even talk in your own hotel room..... overall, not very nice. But boston, beautiful !

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Wexford_IrelandKay
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in December. I had booked the trip before I read the reviews on this site. Needless to say i was very apprehensive after reading them, so much so that i did not even tell my friend of my worrries. Thankfully I need not have worried. We travelled with The Travel Department and had a fabulous weekend of shopping and sight seeing in Boston. The hotel staff were very friendly as were the consierge. We had a big room that had 2 double beds, which were very comfortable. I woke one night to hear people leaving the night club next door but it did not interupt my sleep which you might expect in such a big city The room was cleaned every day and towels changed including Sunday. Bathroom was big with Bath and shower. Our room was located on floor 8. Breakfast was a buffet which had everything from yogurt, fruit etc to bacon eggs etc. The area seems to be under going a lot of construction at the moment and the footpaths are in need of repair, but this was the only `bad` observation I could make. We had a fantastic weekend in Boston, both for shopping and sight seeing and will be back again hopefully. We normally travel with our husbands but left them minding the kids this year, but I have to say as two women travelling alone we felt extremely safe wandering the streets of this beautiful city As for any Irish people travelling with Travel Dept, it is a great trip with a great half day guided tour of the city, with a lady named Cara who certainly knows her stuff. Rock Bottom down the street is a nice restaurant 2 min walk away. Cheesecake factory restaurant is a must if only for coffee and cheesecake!!! Wrentham Village great for shopping...overall better than New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: motions
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one night to see a show at the Wang, (located accross street). We loved the hotel and the staff was exceptionally friendly. Check in was a breeze and from there on we had a great stay.
